title: Can you complete the story 'I hate it when … '? - Quora

response.answer_text: I hate it when… My already miserable and pitiful life takes an enthusiastic plunge for even worse. I sent a transfer request from my current posting, as my required tenure (one year) in this police station was about to conclude and I knew the department will transfer me any day now to a new place… which may or may not suit me in terms of distance and most importantly nature of work. So I jotted down a request, mentioning a few appointments of my liking. I knew it’s going to work as it is the standard procedure. Soon I was supposed to get transfer orders to any one of those three posts I mentioned in my application. And Voila! I got transferred.  Problem is… I never mentioned this post where I’m transferred…. a god damned TRAFFIC POST!!! So… after getting this message and of course a call from headquarters to confirm this…. I just sat down with my head leaned, looking at the floor. Oh my Goodness I’m screwed real good. Next day… I woke up at 6 in the morning and went to the new office. I kid you not…. It is hectic. It’s something so insanely exhausting that I never have witnessed before in seventeen years of my career. Traffic work is totally different than regular police work. And frankly… I don’t know diddly about it. I’ve also remained absent from Quora past few weeks and I regret it every single day. I miss being here so much. Anyway… It is going to be one tough year. But I’ll suck it up and carry on. There is no hardship that can put my fat ass down for good. I will not only make myself compatible with the new environment but I’m also going to enjoy it. I’ll make time and again pick up all my online holy activities and join you to cherish this wonderful community. I will find courage and optimism… I always do.

“I hate it when…” Maria began. Marco looked at her, aware of her sudden speech. He waited for her to continue, but Maria just smiled and waved it away, looking at him and saying, “It’s nothing” before walking away. Marco can only watch her walk alone with a book in her hand. A textbook actually. Unlike the rest in her History class, she actually liked it, and raised her hand so much that Ms. Bhaer began ignoring her in class, searching for another student to have the answers, avoiding Maria’s shine at what she was good at. She was also good at drawing. Marco’s drawings are laughably pitiful at best (a total maestro at stick figures with swollen hands and balloon heads at best and worst), but with Maria, magic and wonder happened immediately from the first line. Out of her ordinary Ticonderoga pencil, flowers bloomed, and people and animals moved—even if stuck in one movement—and everything seemed to breathe and shimmer with wonder. Her art teacher, Mr. Cardinal, never did a class without coming out of his way to praise her, and begged her to show her drawings to an art gallery. At that suggestion, Maria paled and told him she best did not. She feared that people—rich, important people—would come and judge her harshly, and be cruel towards her ability, and say it was ‘amateur and juvenile’. Her classmates snickered at such a comment of fear of judgement and shyness. “She’s just looking for attention.” Jane said in a condescending tone, which seemed hypocritical, since everything she has ever done was for the sake of attention. At that moment, she wore too much mascara, and wore a halter dress so revealing that the classmates saw more skin then cloth. Last summer, she got a boob job for the same reason. Nobody could take her eyes off of her, true. But she attracted nobody, which she could not get. Meanwhile, Maria’s quiet nature, and bright intelligence, and beautiful talent attracted many. And she attracted Marco most of all. She had him from the moment she entered the art classroom in early September, with an opening smile and gentle eyes that looked at him for a millisecond before turning to look at the art supplies that lay before her and the pad of open, bare drawing paper. She had him before she even said, “hello.” Afterward, he would find it difficult to steer his eyes away from her when she does anything. From drawing her latest art masterpiece, to raising her hand desperately for Ms. Bhaer to call on her, knowing the answers nobody else knew, or cared to know anyway. Within a few weeks since she first came to his life, Maria was the top thing in Marco’s mind. History made him think of her ( I wonder if she can know what year the Vikings started invading England. I like completely forgot). Geometric equations (which was Maria’s least favorite subject—he knew by asking—but his favorite) made him think of her. Even panda bears, who have no connection to Maria whatsoever, made him think of her ( she would love holding these little critters in her hand he thought without knowing for sure if she was an animal person. And she can draw them too. Yeah, she would love doing that!). Whether he was aware of it or not, Marco Dela Calle was in love. Deeply, deeply, deeply so in love with her.  With his feelings for her apparent to everyone but Maria (or so he hoped), he began to imagine the craziest scenarios with him and Maria as the main stars of the show. They would go on adventures together, preferably in the forests and jungles, and slay monsters and have magical powers. He imagined himself to have awesome water powers like Percy Jackson, and amazing strength like Adam from Lab Rats (minus his dumbness, of course). Maria meanwhile would have a boatload of knowledge, sunlight powers, and the ability to read minds, and telepathy, which is often how they communicated in his scenarios. Of course, his imagination ran wild about Maria, as he assumes her life, and why she is the way she is. Maybe her dark, evil grandfather from Europe (he just assumes she has a dark evil grandfather from Europe.) was holding her trapped, but this girl found life anyway, drawing to her heart’s content and being good at history, as well as English, and Earth Science. And she holds a locket made of purest gold that can take her and a certain companion back in time to save the world from enemies who wanted to make it crumble and go down with them. Or, or, or, she has this curse that would strike her dead at 17 (they are in high school), and he and Maria must go to another country of another world of werewolves, witches, and fairies that shift forms between pegasi, birds, and humans. Or she was a lost princess, and he, a lowly peasant, grabs her heart anyway. Sometimes the roles changed and switched between Marco and the Maria of his dreams. But neither of them were unimportant, or ignored in any of these scenarios. These scenarios also have a constant: they always contained romance somewhere in their pages and chapters. Marco and Maria will fall in love, and they would kiss under unusually bright moonlight, or at the front of a background of an explosion or firework display that somehow became too quiet and too diminished in magnitude compared to the explosive feeling of passion and heart’s desire that flowed in his veins every second their lips met and parted. They would be so in love with one another, that he would, in those scenarios, basically walk up on stage, sing a stupid love ballad for her (even as his friends tell him with good intentions that his voice sounded like a cow with an ear infection, but in his imaginative mind, sounded like a dream), or more dramatically, die for her in an extremely epic battle scene that so often happened when some crazy but very powerful enemy came and took over their school. Death was an easier fear to face. Everything was much more easier to face in his life than his biggest fear: to say to Maria exactly how he felt about her. He couldn’t. He just couldn’t. In fact, every time Maria looked at him, he blushed red and turned away, embarassed. It became a habit to do so, which he bemoaned. He liked the safety it brought, but Maria, to his feelings which grew with time, remained oblivious and unbeknownst.  “ Forget about her!” Charles said, one of his best friends in high school. “There are other chicks in the sea!” “Fish you mean?” Joe piped up, another one of his best friends. Both are there for him, and they found his new attraction for Maria to be sweet, but completely insane after a while. They were the sole witnesses of his heart’s yearnings and the surreal, neverending tales and scenarios about him and Maria that passed from his heart to his mind through his mouth. “Doesn’t matter.” Charles replied, as he put his hand on Marco’s shoulder. Marco could see the worry written all over his eyes for his poor, benign, lovestruck victim of a friend. “You cannot keep pining after Maria forever, Romeo. You have to find someone else. Who knows, maybe she can be your Rosaline, and your Juliet is just out there, waiting for you.” Not many people knew that behind his charisma, looks, and humor, was a mind that read Shakespeare while the rest of his peers were learning how to tie their shoes—and still does among with other books old and new. Joe was just an average guy, keeping Charles and Marco in the present with the best he could. “Yeah,” Joe added, laying his arm on Charles’s shoulder. “You are spending way too much time thinking about her, Marco. I don’t think she is that interested in you. Not as much as you are to her. I think you should let her go. Forget about her.” After that, Charles and Joe brought Marco to a cafe to talk some more and hang out. But Marco could never forget about Maria, anymore than Maria could ever create bad art. At the state he was in of unrequited love, her torn up drafts were like celebrity goods to him! His feelings for her pulsed and continued, with Maria engraved and burned into his heart, basically for perpetuity. So did the fear of telling her about these feelings and the dread that came with the thought of Maria finding out. So he stayed through sophomore year, stuck in fear and a crazy storm of feelings. Till that summer moment, when Maria was standing next to him, and he was looking away as usual, when she said, “I hate it when…” and Marco looked to her—a real dare—to hear what else she was going to say, only for her to walk away. I hate it when… was a thought that he circled and juggled in his head over and over. What could she mean? What could she be hating? Him looking away. He would stop that in a heartbeat! Jane showing off? He would agree with her too! Ms. Bhaer ignoring her? Mr. Cardinal nagging her to show her artwork to the world? What is it? What? What was it that she wanted to say but did not? Was it to him in the first place? He realized he cannot stand still and quiet about this anymore. So, he decided on the most bravest, most daring thing he has ever done in his life. He looked at where she was sitting, walked over to her, called out her name, looked at her dark brown eyes, and asked her for the rest of her sentence. The one that began with “I hate it when…” The End.

Her brother finally came home after wrapping up the 3-day conference in his college. “I hate it when all females keep talking about the gender discrimination, assaults, body shaming, etc that keeps happening with them. I have read and heard enough about it, i know there are problems with females but its annoying to hear about it over and over again. As if men don’t have problems at all. You females just talk about it all the time.” her brother said. “So when mum tells you to clean your room every month do you do it right away? No, it obviously takes her 10–20 times of repeating the same thing in different tones when you finally listen to her and after 2 weeks your room is dirty again and you need reminder so the cycle begins again.” she replied while organizing the dinner table. “okay i get your point but at some point the cycle has to stop right ? On every social media page and every article and with most of the women its a problem. What do you think about that then ?” he asked her with an exasperated sigh. “Hmm, well it will stop when change comes and stays that way. But with every article/social media post isn’t it good that females finally have new platforms to talk and share about the problems faced ? “ she smiled and then served him the food. “Fine. I’ll try to be more understanding. Also, I am tired of eating lentils every day can’t you cook something better?” he gave her that irritated look again. “The kitchen is all yours too. Please feel free to cook whatever you like whenever you like.” and she walked away to catch up the latest episode of her favorite tv show. :)

“I hate it when you force me to eat something that I don't like” shouted the boy staring grimly at his Aluminium dinner plate that boasted the Upma served by his mother. His mother who just went back to kitchen to do the dishes, remained silent. Frustrated even more with his mom's silence the boy threw away his plate and paced angrily towards the door. His mother who was shocked on hearing the noise of plate hitting the ground, shouted “Rahul! Where are you going. Please have this for today. Tomorrow, mom will do something different for you ”. Rahul, unhindered by his mother's pleading, stormed away from the home. He was walking towards his usual playground. Something made him to stop as near a garbage bin he was able to see the remnants of a thrown away food packet lying on the ground. It looked like as some one had thrown away an opened package that had partially eaten idly’s. Something took his mind to the image back in home, where he had thrown his upma on to the floor. As his mind was lost in thoughts, his eyes saw that an old fragile man probably in his 70’s was picking up the food packet with a glee in eyes. Suddenly his mind was filled with shame and guilt. He realized how fortunate he was to be blessed with something to eat three times a day. He immediately turned back home. His mother was sitting on the Veranda waiting for him. Rahul could see that she was holding his Aluminium plate that had the same upma. But the difference this time was in his face, where there was a glee and guilt instead of the grimace. His mother had carefully collected the Upma that had fell on the floor and saved it for herself, so she could serve the fresh part to her son.

I hate it when someone touches me inappropriately. So,I am going to share this incident first time.I had never told this to anyone. I am a 15 years old girl living in Delhi,Rape capital. 2007 I was 6 years old.I was traveling in a bus with my mother. At that time I travelled in bus a lot. So we were going to my nani house.I was sitting on a seat which was beside the window and enjoying. A boy around 16–-18(i guess) came and sat on the seat behind me.Suddenly he started touching my back,my mother was sitting beside me.It shocked me.Being a 6 year old girl,it was very difficult to accept it.Then that boy started touching my hips.I knew that what was happening to me but I was freezed at that time.I remained quite,I thought that if i will tell this to my mother,she will scold me.That was my biggest mistake.Our stop came,I reached my nani house,but this incident really my soft way to see this world.My hands are shivering while writing this. Sorry i didn't mention all the details because it hurts me.I can't recollect those 20 seconds of my life.I still feel afraid But this incident made me strong. 2015 Now Rakshita is different from that Rakshita. I am not afraid of these rubbish guy. My mom and dad made a strong.They taught me how to face these problems.Now I am Dhakkad So.. I was traveling in a E rickshaw. There was a man who was sitting in front of me.He started rubbing his legs with my legs . I thought that may be he did it by mistake.But that was continuously happening.Then he started pushing my legs.He was smiling.I mean there was a cunning smile on his face. I very calmly said,“Please put your legs there”. He put his legs in another side.But after 5 minutes,he started that again.My mother was also with me.I knew that if i would tell my mother,she will not spare that guy.So what i did? Remained quite…No… i changed myself Slapped him…No..that situation didn't come Ran away…not Rakshita's thing. I simply started starring his eyes in a very bold and serious way.I started starring him in an angry way.I was not blinking my eyes.He really got afraid.He got down from the Rickshaw in hurry and ran away. So I hate it when somebody touches me inappropriately. Thanks Regards Rakshita Sunita Ram (Dhakkad)

“I hate it when you are silent, just talk something”, Dev pleaded. Swaru gazed into the distance. “Swaru, please”, he came closer. She moved a little, still gazing into the distance. “I am sorry, I know this is weird but…”, his voice trailed off as Swaru made an eye contact. “I should have known better, I really didn’t expect this coming, I thought we were good…. Never mind”, she turned around and started walking. His gaze followed her. OMG! Why am I attracted to her like crazy? his emotions weren’t helping him. “Swaru, pls stop! What should I tell him?” She rolled her eyes and placed hands on her hips. “Was she always this cute? Oh god why?”, he murmured under his breath. “Listen, if Shiv likes me, he should have expressed his feelings. Not through a mediator. We might be close…..but still!”. She sounded annoyed. “I told him the same thing. But, he said it would be better if I get to know what you actually feel.. and so”, he shook his head in disagreement with his own statement. “And, all this while you were aware and yet, you didn’t want to tell me!” She raised her eyebrows. If only I had still seen you as my friend, he thought. Swaru’ s mobile started ringing. She excused herself and picked up the call. His thoughts traveled back to that day. Swaru and Dev were close friends since standard X. He had always seen her as his close buddy until that day when she had fallen sick. Out of nowhere, he suddenly started having feelings of her, and even her sneezing looked attractive and not disgusting. On the same day, his friend Shiv called him to say that he likes Swaru and he wanted to know what she thinks about him. Shiv requested Dev to help him. Dev was confused about his feelings, but Shiv was persistent. As days passed, Dev’s feelings grew stronger. From that fateful day, Dev was trying to fight his emotions. “Sir? I had asked you something”, Swaru pat him on his back. “I am sorry”. That was all he could manage to say. He would pull her legs all day when they were friends. He would talk for hours and hours. But now, he could hardly frame sentences. Swaru took out a hairband from the bag and tied her hair into a bun. His heartbeat was raising. He was falling hopelessly for her every minute. Should I tell her, he thought for a second. He was struck between his friendship with Shiv and his love for Swaru. Cons of falling in love with your bestie. Swaru could feel the tension. She didn’t like the idea of Dev being all nervous. She hid a smirk and started walking towards the car. “Shall we go to that coffee shop? I am hungry” Swaru declared not waiting for his answer. He followed her helpless. Thousands of emotions rushed as his car engine roared back to life. Swaru sent a text to her friend. “Can't this stupid Dev just say? I don’t want to see him like this. But, I will wait until this dumbo opens his mouth to express his own feelings, and not that of his friends. I am meeting Shiv tomorrow to clear things up” Dev tried to peep into her mobile screen. Swaru hit him playfully thinking how she had fallen for this hopeless idiot.

I hate it when people look at me and make weird face like they never saw a human like me before. I was born orphan. Left on the road to survive in this bewildering world. I was tiny and no one was there to take care of me, till I was taken in by a woman. She gave me shelter, food and good clothes and unconditional love. She used to work in an organisation. Like every child, I wanted to go to school and she allowed me without any hesitation. But my mother never came to the school. She used to send a colleague from her work. Once I hit puberty I saw something was changing in me. My nipples started growing with my facial hair. It was shocking for me that my mind can't figure out if I wanted to be a man or a woman. I want to talk and walk like a man, but somewhere I was being suppressed by my own body. The struggle was hard. My hips and chest started moving out with Adam's apple. And for this my friends used to make fun of me. I had my bad days. I used to cry alone and every time my mother consoled me by saying “This is just a bad phase. It will pass away”. Now I am a fully grown woman, with a corporate job in Berlin. One day I was having a random conversation with my mom. “When I asked her why did she pick me?” She gave me a beautiful answer “ I am one of those who had struggle to have a respect for my identity. I want other people to respect you too​, for who you want to be. I want you to have an identity. I don't want another kid who is abandon because of their different gender.” At this tears roll down my eyes. I want to hug her really tight. But all I can do is, look at my computer screen and smile with my watery eyes.

I hate it when people expect others to read their minds. I've come across many people who often fail to express their current state of mind and blame it on others for not “understanding” them. It is usually desired that the other person should know that you're sad/angry/hurt/happy without even you demonstrating the same in any manner. And when others “read their minds” (start assuming) ,it usually turns out to be a wrong guess,which further results into the person stating things like “How could you simply imagine things about me? I wasn't even sad because of that!” . Even worse in situations like: “Do you have any preferences for your pizza toppings?” “No. Whatever you like” *Pizza arrives* “I didn't wanted olives on my pizza . I hate the taste of it!” exclaims the person who didn't mention the same earlier. Even I fail to verbalize my thoughts at times, but then I have started considering to not get mad when people don't comprehend my emotions for I, didn't put in any efforts to explain them either.(certainly cannot hope for extra cheese when I didn't even ask for it). Inexpressive behaviour confuses people or as I'd like to say,annoys all. If one cannot voice his/her thoughts,then one shouldn't complain for not being acknowledged. Trust me,if people had the ability to wander inside each other's minds then lives would have been wretched. Be communicative about your thoughts if you want people to know instead of playing the “Guess what?” games.It'll be more effective and less irritating. Thanks for reading.

I hate it when the person who once checked upon me every now and then ,doesn’t even look at me now,even though we are so close,yet are hearts are distance apart.. The person with whom I could talk about anything and everything the whole day says that he can’t think about a topic to talk to me .. The person who once cared too much,knew my darkest secrets,called every now and then, doesn’t even bother to call except birthdays and festivals.. Worry is not about those who leave ,Worry is about those who leave back some memories and leave. He gave me as many excuses as he could,I gave him as many chances as I could,Later I realized that every chance was the food for the next excuse.. And I have learnt a very important lesson of my life,that our happiness shouldn’t depend on people ,People come,People go as new people enter their lives..they start taking you for granted because they know that you are gonna remain on their side forever,to support,to help,to listen to them no matter how much broken or busy you are… We can’t find our happiness in people or materialistic things,we can find our true happiness only inside ourselves,finding peace of mind inside our soul is better than expectations that we carry in our heart from other people. Yes, losing your heart’s desire is tragic. But gaining your heart’s desire ? That’s all I hope for. This year I wished for self love, to immense myself in no one else but me and make my heart afraid to feel that I am incomplete. My wish was granted. And if having that is tragic, then give me tragedy. Because I wouldn’t give it back for the world. For it is all me that I hold within myself, not the world. All for self and none for someone else

“I hate it when someone disturbs the discipline of my class. What’s there to laugh about? You are free to leave the class.” Said the infuriated professor pointing towards her. Moments ago, the whole class bursted into laughter to a joke cracked by someone. The professor specifically pinpointed her from the group. “I am sorry Sir.” She apologised as she stood at her place in regret. “You are a girl. You should be ashamed. Just get out of this class right now.” The discourteous professor replied back. She was taken aback by the harsh words. Tears started rolling from her eyes as she put her head down, wrapped all her items kept on the table into her bag & went out of the class. “Pardon me Sir! But, that is too harsh & disrespectful on your part. She has done nothing as such to be ashamed of. She just had a laugh, as most of us present in the class, at a joke cracked by someone else.” He stood up from his place & advocated as she stepped outside. “Who are you to defend her? Is this the way to talk to your Teacher?” The furious professor questioned. “I am sorry. I’ll leave the class too.” He replied audaciously & started to walk outside as the professor looked in awe. He rushed downstairs in search of her. She was sitting at one corner, with her head down, near the entrance. He went near & sat beside her. Slowly he extended his hand to hold hers. She could easily recognise the familiar touch of his, without looking up. “Why did u come out of the class?” She asked with a sad tone. “Stop crying. Cheer up. The world is full of morons like him.” He consoled. She leaned towards him, slowly moving her head to rest on his shoulder, fingers firmly entwined with his. He used his other hand to wipe away her tears. “You are the world to me.” She said after a long pause.

I hate it when people generalize and try to measure me based on age-old,pre-defined social norms. Recently I was really frustrated and wanted to switch my job as there was no growth for me in that company. I was in a big MNC but I wanted to grow professionally and financially. The reply I received from most of my colleagues and friends is why you want to lose your mental peace over career, anyway you are married,let your husband take care of the finance,and you take care of your home.Earning money is not mandatory for you anyway. Why? Just because I am a wife now. I hate it when people take my career aspirations as a second prioriy based on my marrital status. I had faced several other incidents where people judged me based on my look, gender, choices etc. and everytime it happend I hated it more and more. There is a reason why we all are so different from each other.Every person has their own abilities, disabilities, looks, features, strength and weakness. Isn't being same all the time really boring. Even if we have same background and going through the same phase of our life,we might handle the situations in an entirely different way.Its OK if we have different feelings about a certain thing, The best thing we can do as an evolved species is AGREE to DISAGREE Try to embrace each other's choices as they want it to be.Even a small encouragement from peers and family and can help to grow a person invariably.

Cheers!

THE LUCKY ONES… “I hate it when people tell me I am the lucky one to have you as my wife.”, Varnan said, teasing to Kavita, while washing the plates. Kavita smiled at her loving husband’s not-so-convincing complaint, and continued emptying the remaining food into smaller bowls. “I mean… What’s lucky… I didn’t receive you as a prize to a lucky draw or Housie where mostly luck is involved to win…That Nilesh, kept saying lucky lucky and ate three bowls of Kheer, I couldn’t have even one extra spoon..”, he continued, “Remember how much I tried to impress your father to let me be his son-in-law? Not every one’s cup of tea. I even tried to learn those difficult calculations from my roommate so that I could help you out and in turn spend more time with you, else you could have failed you know. Lucky… Huh… It’s not lucky, it’s dedication… ” Kavita kept saying “Hmm” while smiling, trying to control her laughter. “I am almost done, see if any plate or bowl is left to wash”, Varnan said while keeping the last washed plate aside in the basket. “Oh, yes! Wait. Take this plate”, Kavita said kept a plate behind Varnan on the table. Varnan still talking, turned to take the plate to be surprised with a bowl of kheer. “Khee… you already had k…” and without completing his statements, he washed his hands, grabbed a spoon and started munching on the last bowl of the delicacy. “So, Mr. So-Unhappy hubby! Did I pass the Kheer test or not?”, Kavita said with a twinkle in her eyes. “Umm… Hmm.. By the way, Nilesh wasn’t totally wrong. I am lucky… after all, I didn’t know I would get so intelligent wife who can cook my favorite dish and even hide extras for me.”, he said, keeping the empty bowl aside and pulling Kavita towards him. “Aha! Mister, not just you. Even I learnt how to make Kheer from my roommate for you only, so I can give it when you come to teach me calculations which I already knew how to solve…”, Kavita said giggling. They both laughed at these not-so-hidden secrets revealed and hugged each other with love.

I hate it when people waste natural resources . It is weirder than you think..... I really really don't appreciate when people waste resources.  And I still don't understand why would someone waste resources knowing that there is shortage. People are starving and some are wasting food..... That's crazy..... But even crazier is to know that the wasted food is healthy vegetables.  Nobody wastes junk food. I am not encouraging to waste junk food but I think the healthy food should be respected equally. “I hate it when you make me wait like this,” Meera shouted. “Relax. The washroom was under maintenance. I already rushed faster.” Raj answered. “Alright. Now can we please go home?” Meera pleaded. “Yeah. Let’s go.” Raj answered. Raj and Meera sat inside the car while Raj drove back to their home from the mall. Around two hours later, the doorbell buzzed. “Raj, open the door.” Meera shouted from the bedroom. “Are you kidding? Virat is on 99.” Raj answered while looking at television in the hall. Meera came out of her bedroom and opened the door. The courier guy handed her the courier which had her name on it. First, she was surprised as she hadn’t ordered anything in those days. But, when she opened it, she found the same designer dress which she was gazing at while sipping her coffee. The smart girl understood everything. She turned back to Raj’s side and asked Raj, “Why?” Raj, who was already turned towards to the door side answered, “Because, you liked it.” “I didn’t even tell you. Then, how did you know that I was looking at the dress and I like it?” Raj smiled and answered, “Because, I was only looking at you.” The century celebration moment happened on both on & off screen.

The news of our honored dead filters every month on social media hotspots popular to my countrymen. It's doesn't look as good from my view where I always deal with reports of felled colleagues_when I am.not handling their cadavers. I lost dear friends in that dreaded jungle. The idiots don't know the value of combat medics like myself, murdering each and everyone, no consideration, even members during their intra-rivalry fights. “I hate it when someone else even dares to think about playing with my prey. “Do you wanna know why I abducted you, sweetheart? You… You mean nothing. Your existence means nothing… It's the thrill and challenge that came with you… That is what I sought… Yes! That is what I sought…” He whimpered. Adrenaline rushed throughout my body, looking at his teary eyes. “I know who you are, Sweetheart. That's why killing you makes it soooo fun. But,” His eyes began to hope. I laughed. That was all he could do. But with him, my mission came to an end. My fifteen year long mission. I wanted to know why. Why did Boss die just after delegating this assignment to me? Did he kill him? “sweetheart, I love you so much, sweetheart… That's precisely why the sweetheart deserves the sweetest dreams of all… I have lived a life unknown to anyone… But I'm gonna give you the liberty of remembering me, sweetheart… I'll haunt you till the day of your death!” I slit my wrist letting him watch me die. Now that my tale of death has come to an end, tell me, Ghost to Ghost… Why'd you die, Boss? “Oh, that? That's cuz with the war over, I had no reason to live. Whatever I've loved was taken away by peace and whatever I've hated was taken away by war… What reason did I have to exist anymore??”

“I hate it when you chomp your food so loudly” she says. … “I also hate it when you don't pay me attention” she says raising her voice. He lifts his head to meet her narrowed eyes and gazes at them for a moment. The same eyes he fell in love with, the eyes with such a depth where he learnt to swim. He breaks the gaze with a sly grin and says, “I know”. “And yet you do it. It's been 6 years”, she says and turns away, unable to hide her smile. “Time to stop it you say? Alright! But tell me something else to irritate you with” “I thought you knew everything about me”, she purses her lips together and fakes puppy eyes. He gets up and walks to sit beside her on the sofa. “Well, maybe I don't”. Looking sternly at her, he adds “Tell me. What's the thing that makes you fear me the most?” She looks in his eyes and can feel the tension building up on him. “Rahul, I was just joking around. You don't have to do this”, she says as she places her hand on his shoulder. “No. I've always wanted to know. Tell me” he says boring his eyes deeply into hers. She slowly lowers her eyes, away from his gaze, and says, “Your fear”. “Huh?” “Your fear. I've seen you when you face them. I don't know what they are, Rahul. But whenever you fall in the deepest and darkest pit of your life, I fear that I might not be there for you. That I might not hear your cries. I hate to see you so afraid, so helpless. And maybe, maybe I might not understand you then”. As she looks at him, he sees her fear consuming her, her worst nightmare playing with her in front of her own eyes. He takes her another hand into his and asks, “Then what do you hate in me? No, not pet peeves. Something that you legitimately hate about me”. She pauses for a few seconds and says, “It's when you try to control things beyond your reach. You try to control them when everything's gone haywire, then get frustrated and crack up. It brings out the worst in you”. His smile weakened. His heart sank. Yet he asked, “Then what do you love about me?” “I don't love anything about you”. He smiled as she was joking. But she wasn't. As he stared at her, he understood that she meant every word. He was perplexed. “I love you. I love everything that makes you, you. Every tiny speck of dust that makes the universe inside you, every bit of humanity left inside you, every beat your heart makes to keep you alive, every beat it makes me skip when I see you, every shred of your skin that catches me on fire, every colour that fills your eyes, every emotion that you feel… you might not be perfect, Rahul. But as long as you complete me and me you, and beyond, I love you. I can't just love something about you! I love everything about you”, she said, her eyes with fire in them. Their love was rekindled once again. They looked at each other in the same way when they had first met. She leaned into him and he whispered, “I love you too Ayesha”. They kissed with passion so fierce that always burned brighter everyday that passed by.  P.S: There are some grammatical errors that I can't spot. Feel free to suggest edits. Thanks!

“I hate it when you calls yourself my mother” shouted Zara. “You're not worthy to be called my mother, understand”? The mid aged looking lady pretended not to hear it. Cmon, are you not hungry?” the mid aged woman asked her little girl who is no more a little girl now. “I don't want to eat anything touched by you” shouted Zara while crying and tears were rolling down her cheeks. Something is wrong with Zara today and her mother had sensed this. “What happened beta?” asked her mother while walking towards her. “You don't dare to come near me” said Zara wiping her tears. “I can't understand anything. Tell me clearly what happened. I don't have much time as I have to go office” said her mother. “Office? Which office? Why didn't you tell us where you go in the name of office? Why didn't you tell us that you're a nude model? I am feeling disgusting to have a mother liikkee…. and suddenly her mother slapped her hard. And while gaining consciousness that mid aged lady felt it is already morning. “Thank God it was just a dream” said the lady while yawning. She ran to Zara's room. “It's not the perfect time to tell you my reality beta as you're not mentally ready for it. It wouldn't have happened if your father didn't divorce me for giving birth to you” thought the lady while looking at her innocent daughter sleeping. Some secrets should remain secret until it's the perfect time.

Back when I was in high school, we had written and spoken exams in our English class. Once, my English teacher decided to test our story writing and speaking skills. For our spoken exam she set a particularly interesting yet challenging exam. She pulled out or English textbook and flipped to a random page and recited the first line of that page which went something like, “I hate it when I get surprises.” And she said, “Time to put your thinking caps on. I’ll give you 10 minutes. Let’s see who can come up with an interesting short story which either begins or ends with this line. After that each of you will come up to the front and read out your story.” To give you some background on the short story that I wrote, I had just started watching football so I decided to start writing a story along those lines. My story went something like this. Sitting in the VIP box, X was feeling particularly pleased with himself as the home side were leading by 3 goals within the first 30 minutes. X was a bookie. He had made a fortune betting on football games and today was another normal day business done right. By the end of the first half, he was satisfied with the way the home team was performing was assured of a huge payout at the end of this game. But, little did he know what fortune had in store for him. With the advent of the second half, the away team played like a team on a mission. Within the first 10 minutes of the second half, seeing the way the away team was playing, a twinge of doubt entered X’s mind but he brushed it away thinking scoring 3 goals would be next to impossible. But the away team’s captain had other plans. Within the next 15 minutes, to shock of the home fans and X, he not only set up 2 goals but also scored 2, leading the away side to victory. Flabbergasted and annoyed at what had just transpired, X looked around to see if he was the only one in a state of shock. The person sitting next to him had gone pale and all the color had drained from his face. As they made eye contact, X said “There goes my money down the drain. I hate it when I get surprises.” Needless to say, my teacher was extremely happy and “surprised” that I had come up with such an interesting story in such a short time. To nobody’s “surprise” I was among those who ended up receiving the highest marks on that spoken exam.

I walk out confident and I return flustered, and then I return again even more flustered. The people at work make bets on how many times I’ll come back for my stuff. I chant this incantation every time I leave. Phone, purse, money, glasses, keys. I won’t ever grow another arm, I can’t seem to force my self into mindfulness. It’s embarrassing. I lost a Christmas present this year because I can’t keep track of more than two packages. Why? I’m not stupid. I can be extremely organized. I have a fantastic memory for everything else. My kid has this expectation that I can keep track of her stuff. I can’t. I just chant another litany. Backpack, lunch, chapstick,hoodie, water bottle, library book. Similar to being unable to keep track of more than two things in public, I lose my keys, my ATM card, my glasses (I need them to drive) and my phone at home. I hate it when that happens too.
