One day, my parents decide to search a good boy for me. They thought as it is difficult for them to search a good boy and a good family as I have complexion on my face. And everyone wants a fair girl so that it was not an easy task. In my own brother’s wedding I met a lady. It was month of June, it was too hot and everyone got sweat on his/her face. And I am a complexed girl I was also not in a good situation. I didn't do any makeup as I don't like to do so. She called me and made me sit beside her. She was so rude she starts judging me first on my accessories,on my ear rings and asking me about make-up why I not did any make-up. She was making me feel embarras. I know what the result was of that meeting. But after wedding my parents asked them about me. The answer was very clear they rejected me because of my complexion and my parents was very sad. They are still in worry as I am still unmarried because of my complexion but they are not losing their hope and finding a well educated boy because they are giving me a well education and making meself-dependent. My parents says that “everyone is beautiful in his/ her own way” this thought make me inspiring..

“I hate it when they volley a string of irksome questions under the pretence of enquiry as soon as I enter the hall? grrr!” Aarohi complained to Shambavi under her breath staring on to her eyes angrily. Shambavi stood with pale face and stammeringly opens her mouth to utter something to assuage angry Aarohi, which is interrupted by Aarohi as she pulls Shambavi clutching her hands into one of the rooms nearby. “Mom!! This is why I don't feel comfortable in marriage gatherings or the like and do you get that now at least?!” asked Aarohi vexedly heading close to Shambavi’s ears. “No dear, listen to me” uttered Shambavi as she closed her eyes and ears due to Aarohi's loud voice. “Are you happy now for having spoiling my long waited weekend mood! Yes???!! My strict hostel warden and mess are far better to these bugs here is all I feel!” Yelled Aarohi interrupting Shambavi and sat on the metal cot banging it with her fists. “Aarohi!!! Language!” warned Shambavi and sat beside her. Shambavi comforted Aarohi holding her hands. “You promised me you won't react so much my dear! Calm down my sweetpie. It is very common to put such questions to youngsters like you!” said Shambavi. “Ahh! You only know to say this! You know every single being attending this marriage will ask, how is hostel, how's studies, marks, when is your marriage, blah blah blah and should I answer it faking a smile till my jaw slips down!? And know what Sunitha maami asked me! She wrongly related me with my bestie Atul as his girlfriend. Effect of my recent Instagram post on his birthday!!” retorted Aarohi. “And more than that you know what Venkat mama said? Your police brother!! This generation is like that only. They do everything but call it friendship. He said it with a smirk. And said, our Aarohi is not like that anyways, in a taunting tone and gave a shrug!” said Aarohi Shambavi chuckled. “Dear I know about you and Atul too… Do you think I need that explanation! Sunitha bhabhi is old and she might have asked it out of care beta. As far as I know, she is not a gossip type and Venkat is little conservative and much worried as he sees so many such cases these days at police station”, replied Shambavi. “I called you to accompany me at this wedding of my favorite cousin's close relative. That's it. I can't go alone always. Neither your Navy officer dad nor you could know that feel of a homealone mother! Why do you bother to answer every question they put to you!?” asked shambavi “Not all are bad! And some purposely kindle your anger by weird enquiries. I know it. Ignore it! But Venkat is really concerned about you beta! He is not a third person to you! Reply him in a polite way instead why do you stress your pump so much and spoil your peace!? Sweetpie, calm down!” added Shambavi. Aarohi sighed. “Enough mom. I can't take it anymore. Let me catch the noon train and get back to my hostel all alive before my nerves puff up here! When on the holy earth would these people change!? These folk will never change! Neither you mom.” said Aarohi. Shambavi chuckled. “Yeah you are right. People nowadays never change only wonders why others don't!” said Shambavi with a smuggish smile. Aarohi caught her pun and stared at Shambavi. “You know something, if they don't question you at all, it means they are least bothered about you! Venkat has done so many things to me when I had a tough time when you were born and Raju was three year old kid while your father was on offshore duty! Its Venkat and Sunitha bhabi who helped me a lot.Venkat never made me think about my mom anytime.”, explained Shambavi “Mom! Mom! Mom! Enough. I don't want to hear this 20 years story again and again!” uttered Aarohi reluctantly. “Once if you had thought about it, there wouldn't have been a need for me to tell it so many times! When your father is away, he subconsciously thinks it his responsibility to care his sister’s children and he is good friend of your dad too. He may sound rude but he loves you so much.” Said Shambavi. “Oh! Really mom??! You know the way he spoke and you call it a reflection of care? Wow!” Aarohi tried to utter somemore but remained calm seeing Shambavi stare at her! “If you keep ignoring our own people for petty things like this, you will end up lonely one day and yearn for someone to speak with. And when you realise it you will be in even bigger mess. No matter how ever dear, friends cannot fill a relative’s place. This attitude of yours will affect your children as well. Remember my words!!” said Shambavi. Shambavi walks out of the room irked before Aarohi tries to retort! After this, Aarohi some how made excuses and stopped visiting native place and marriage gathering from that day. Upon completing her graduation, she got an decent Job as IT professional with an attractive salary abroad. People out there don't bother nor question about others personal much like in own country was her original complacence. Then after getting married, she settled in US as how she wished for longtime! When her son Aadesh grew up there and he had difficulties in gelling with his own grandparents. He was overtly influenced by that culture which was not his fault definitely. When Aarohi tried to make him understand that she got same strings of questions from her son! She became thoughtful and started missing her mom. And understands what her mother said turned true and was worried about her future with her son! “I thought my own uncle as third person. My son who is not even 16 thinks his own grandparents are third persons and what will be my place in few more years??!” said Aarohi to herself. She calls up her mom teary eyed to pour out her gushing emotions!  Story inspiration: my mother's general advices! Aarthy Priyadharshini Ramesh (ஆர்த்தி பிரியதர்ஷினி)

“I hate it when mom and dad takes your side even if they knew me so long.” Gambhir confessed to his wife. His wife giggled at the childish jealousy of her husband.  “I hate it when you try to hide the scars from me.” confessed Dhruv, as he caress her lovers' battle scars from acid attack.  “I hate it when nothing goes right!” screamed Tanisha. “Darling, what’s wrong?” her mother rushes to her as she receives her from the door. Furrowed lines present on her forehead and her paled face, worries her mother. “Mummy, you know about the hours of hardwork I put in for the project, every single night from past one month. Now, Ravi Sir gave the project to Natasha. Mummy, I worked so hard on it. She didn’t even start on her project. How’s it fair?” Tanisha complains as she lays her head down on her mother’s lap. “It’s okay beta. Just wait, and see. Everything will be good in the end.” Her mother cajoles her. After some days.. “Mama, you were right! I submitted my projects to one of the best professor in college, senior to Ravi Sir. He loved the project, and is ready to be my mentor for it.” A huge smile formed on her mother’s face as she heard the happiness bubbling in her voice.  “I hate it when you shower her with more kisses.” Priya informs her husband playfully. “Honey, she’s my only princess.” Samrat replies with a smile. “What about me then?” Priya asks in fake anger. “You are my Queen, darling!” Samrat replies with a wider smile, still cuddling and kissing their 3 year old daughter. Priya perks up and smiles, knowing that she was just pulling her husband’s legs.  Picture Source: Google

I hate it when I can’t fall asleep. I hear only the clock ticking inside the room like there is only the sound of a heavy ship swinging in the rough sea. The blanket and the sheet are all warm. Flipping over the pillow allows me to put my head on the cold side. I once again close my eyes, this time hoping to enter the realm of dreams; to stop thinking anymore. Some shapes in colors appear indistinctly at first. I see them only for a minute or two. Then thoughts cut in again, like large snowflakes, falling heavily inside my head. “Could it be her phone, ran out of battery?” “Could she be out, with her friends, drunk maybe?” “Could she get back home safe?” “Could she already have fallen asleep?” “Would I have awakened her, if I had called?” “Should I have told her that I lo…” I wake up with the continuous vibration of the phone. When I reach out to it, the vibration stops. I see an unread message on the screen. “I could read your message just now. Sorry, it was a long night at the office. I will call you again after getting some sleep.”

-I hate it when you do that! -Do what? -When you let a bunch of your hair loose like that. -And why is that, may I ask? -This fringe (points with his forefinger) makes you look irresistibly hot. -Being hot is my right. And privilege—I presume... Oh, does someone feel overly possessive when their wife looks so ‘attractive’? (raises her brows) -Oh no no no no. I just feel like taking your hair like this (holds the hair bunch between his thumb and forefinger) and pushing it behind your ear (tucks the fringe). Ah, now that's more relaxing. (Heaves a sigh of relief.) (She pulls the frill back to the side of her temple.) -O dear wifey. Why do you tempt me? Might I remind you that there are at least half a dozen minors in this hall right now? And one of them is a teenage girl who, for the last five minutes, is concentrating more on us than on the food in her plate. (Points to the nosy teenager with his eyes.) So. Put. That. Hair. Back! -No. -No? -No. -Why, oh why? -Because I'm a feminist. And the first rule of feminism is: don't listen to your husband! My body. My hair. My wish. -(Raises brows.) You'll regret this. (Calls the waiter and places the order.) -I don't think I will regret anything. -Oh, you will. (Five minutes pass. They are half way through the dinner.) -So hubby, how was your day? -It was alright. (He looks at her. Rolls his head as though intoxicated.) Ah. (Holds the menu card as an opaque barrier between his face and hers.) Got to hear a few, “Happy Wedding Anniversary” wishes in the office. The rest of the day was just fine. How was yours? -About the same. Other than, “Happy Wedding Anniversary Smitha!,” “Where is Akash taking you to tonight?” the day was mediocre. (They proceed to the main course.) -Akash! Why are you holding the menu card like that?! (Pushes the card down.) -I can't keep looking at that dangling frill and not do something about it! (Holds the menu card back up.) -You are being ridiculous. -No. I am being cautious. -Cautious of what? -My temptation. -You are not a teenager anymore to say that dude! (Takes the menu card and keeps it on a neighbouring table.) Look at me. -Oh darling, let’s not do this. Please. -Don’t be so childish Akash. -Hmm. (They move to dessert.) -So my dear hubby, do I get an anniversary gift? -I thought I wouldn’t. But that hair frill right there is tempting me to gift you one. -And what gift would that be? (He stands up, leans forward. Gives a look at the nosy teenage girl—her spoon has stopped midway between her plate and mouth. He leans further. Smitha is too shocked to react. Akash is so close to her face now. He blows the fringe away to the back. Smitha looks at him without daring to bat an eyelid. He inhales the fragrance of her body, and gives a gentle heave. She is still too awestruck to respond. With one quick motion, he touches her lips with his. It lasted for less than a second. She was not even sure it happened. The prying teenage girl drops her spoon in shock. She gives a sudden gasp, and shuts her mouth with her palms. Before her parents could see what had shocked their daughter, Akash had sat down.) -Huh. How was the gift? (with an evil smile.) -?! -Not like it? -(in whispering tone) What were you even thinking?! Finish the dessert. Quick. Let’s leave. -I warned you that you would regret this. -Eat. Quick. -Okay dear, okay… Chill… (Ten minutes later, they are walking down the road. There is gentle breeze.) -Someone is still mad at me. -No. -Yes. -No. -Yes. -That… That was so… so… huh, nothing. Drop it… -Okay. (Five minutes later, they are close to home.) -Akash, why are you looking down? -Wondering if my surprise was instead a shock to you. -Look at me. -No. -Look at me you idiot. (Akash looks up at his wife walking beside him. She had pulled the frill back to the front again. There was an evil smile on her lips.) -My God! I hate it when you do that!

I hate it when people discourage me! Yes! That will be the only reason for me to hate someone.  If someone keeps on telling me that I can't do something, I will literally decide not to meet that person till my end! I hate that attitude of threatening someone that something can't be done just because the person giving such advice couldn't do! See! Everyone at some point of time will feel low and inferior in life and will bounce back in due course. This is natural! But deliberately discouraging someone just because that person does something which you don't like or you didn't have an opportunity to do, is like back stabbing the person who respects your advice or suggestion….! I have no room for negative people in my life and for those who picturise future as something that's not worthy enough to work hard for and dream about! I strongly believe that I am capable of reaching great heights and when someone tells something contrary to that I can't tolerate that! Only for people who don't actually have vision about their future or those who want to settle easily in other's hardwork, my dreams and visions would seem to be a day dream! And I am sure those stalwarts have got nothing to do with my life…..! My wings are ready for partnership only with those who dream and think high just like me (and I have got an awesome partner who flies with me and reaches heights with me with the same passion as I have) and work towards the same and definitely not for those who threaten and try to pull me back!

“I hate it when you just say bye” she said disappointed. “Then, should I say hi again” he chuckled as he turned to leave. She called him. “That's all? Just bye?” He was trying hard to hide his feelings. He wanted to laugh hysterically seeing her innocence. “Yes,” he said from the back and started to walk. 10 seconds. No response. He was expecting her to scream. That's the reason why he was walking pretty slowly. But no response. Did she walk away becoming furious? He turned back. A smile erupted on his face seeing her unmoved. And a smile emanated from her face as soon as he turned back. He couldn't hold back. He sprinted the distance and he was infront of her in no time. And without second thought he hugged her. She hugged him immediately. “I love you. Can I stay back for another hour?” He said. “No. Two hours! Come,” she said dragging him as she moved towards the icecream joint. Avi

“I hate it when you can’t take a decision in your life”, my inner soul answered. Outer soul replied,”I can’t , If I propose her at a time like this she may stop talking to me”. Then comes a beautiful girl with her hair flowing along the air current. Her eyes are soulful enough to stare her lifetime . Her voice is as sweet as Cuckoo’s sound sweet enough to melt a rock. She is an Goddess of Beauty.Her Charming, her smile, her lips, her face, her dimples everything seems to be calling me close enough to kiss her. The aroma which she emits gives me an refreshing feeling. And then she comes closer and Says “Hie” and I’m still staring at her glamourous beauty even the words can’t describe. She: Hellooooooooooooooooooooo Me: Still glaring at her closly observing eaving the world apart. She: “Claps infront of my face” Me: Heyyy She : What are you looking at? Me: “Thinking How the God created such a beauty!!” Nothing just about the new earpiece you wore. It is beautiful. She: Thank You Me: I love You. My heart started beating faster, her reaction seemed to be dulled and after thinking about 4 mins.she replied. She: I love you toooo.. I thought I’m the happiest and the most luckiest person on the earth.And after seeing her we are about to come closer and kiss, Then I hear my Sister’s voice saying that “Mommmm, again brother is making some weird faces in the sleep”. Then I woke up to realise that I’m in sleep and realise that I have forgotten the face of the Beautiful Girl with whom I was about to kiss. and I felt “Oh! God”. I have to wake up and just follow the daily routine of my Single, Routine and Boring Life…………………. Lesson for Life:: Girls are always beautiful in the sleep rather than the real life.

“I hate it when you keep telling me what to do. I'm 18 mom. I can handle my life.” “I hate it when you tell me to inform you wherever I go. Don't you trust me? Give me a break, mom!” “I hate it when you force me to eat ‘healthy’. I love junk food mom.” “I hate it when you ask me not to drive too fast. Where's the adrenaline rush if I'm driving slowly? You're so old fashioned mom!” These were words Savitha heard everyday from her daughter, Tanya. She just smiles through everything, hoping her daughter would understand one day. That day never seems to come, unfortunately. Tanya gets a call one evening. “Mom calling” the Mobile screen reads. She picks up the call and screams, “ Mom, I'm fine. I think I told you I'll be late today.” She hears a sob on the other side. It wasn't her mom. Her dad asks her to get home as soon as she can. Tanya is terrified. She rushes home only to find a crowd in front of their house. Her dad comes out crying. Tanya is numb. She walks into her house and finds her mother's cold body lying on the bed, motionless. Was it really happening to her? She screams and cries. She begs her mother to wake up. Alas, it was too late. Her mother had a cardiac arrest and passes away. Tanya cannot forgive herself for her behaviour towards her mother. She realises her folly, but it was too late to fix it. Every single day she thinks, “I hate it when you aren't with me mom. I miss you. I'm sorry.” “I hate it when I think of the harsh words I spoke to you. How I wish I could rectify it!” “I hate it when I realise that our house is just a room with 4 walls now. It’s no longer our “home”. “I hate it when I want to tell you how much I love you, but you aren't around for me to tell you that.” Life is too short to have regrets. We could value the people who love and care for us unconditionally. That does make life worth living. Doesn't it?

I hate it when Civilized people act like uncivilized or even worse than them. Today , I am going back to my college via train. Indian railways usually get late during winters because of fog and many other conditions. As a consequence of fog, Our train is also running approximately 20:35 hours late. So in this train almost 70 % of the co passengers are very well educated as far as I think but according to me there is no benefit of your knowledge if you don't know how to behave properly. Case 1: So I am travelling via Duranto Express and in this train they serve both Lunch as well as Dinner but because of some unknown reasons, yesterday passengers were given only Dinner. Since the train has more than 1000 people waiting for dinner and staff is lesser as compared. So the train staff was making their best efforts to not let anyone die of hunger and they served dinner at around 7 pm. This is quite early for a North Indian but since none of the passengers have eaten a full meal since last 12 hours so we all were hungry. But what I listened after two minutes shook my mind.One of my co passengers ,lets call him X. He got angry on Railway staff and he shouted on them. Mr. X said “Aee khana leke aa jaldi bhukhe hai”. (Bring the food fast we are hungry). His voice was of commanding nature as if the whole railway staff was his slave. I had no grudges till now but I did not like the way he talked. After getting his dinner, He started finding mistakes in it like chawal garam nhi hai (Rice is not served hot) and all types of mistakes. He compared the dinner with those of local trains. He even indulged in a word fight with railway staff when one of the staff member told them their conditions Case 2: Almost each and every Indian know our so called Swachh Bharat Abhiyan but still have a look in Indian Railways. What we do and then we complain Indian Trains are not clean as compared to other nations. We will have to work for our country. No one else will do. These are the packets of Chips and other eatables. Can't the passengers put these empty wrappers into their bags and make trains much cleaner. India is Great and Indians are greatest. Peace  P.S. I loved the food because I have not eaten anything since last 18 hours or even more.

I hate it when- Broken and damaged are mocked, Feeble and weak are hammered. It's okay not to be okay with yourself, When your body aches and ravages, And your soul gets emptied and frozen. Silent screams when touch the scars, Will it bleed? Or will it get healed? I stand still in front of the mirror, To hide my imperfections and flaws. When I wash my face, tears roll down... And when I throw off water on the mirror, That face with bruises From outside, I live with a smile, Yet the inside of me is  full of despair. From outside, I live with the eyes full of joy, Yet the inside of me hides tears of sadness. From outside, I live with a smile that brightens surroundings, Yet the inside of me screams aloud with anger. From outside, I live a life that everyone envies, Yet the inside of me resides with insecurities. From outside, I live a life of courage, Yet the inside of me carries fears and wants to die. When I speak, silence takes over it, I cry out with the notion that no one will hear. I always remain unseen, I have pain carved inside of me, Please let me be free... :)

I hate it when people start to literally judge a woman's character based on their observation. We are living in the 21st century, but our minds are still stuck in the same orthodox society which was once patronized by Aurangzeb. 1: X was eating a plate of chowmein along with her friend circle, some of them were boys. The aunties of our colony saw this and started this usual rant: X is shameless. 2: Y use to love a guy, who dumped her. She is heartbroken, there is no one who can understand her feeling. All she needs is a support from her loved ones. But our stereotype aunties bash their parents, saying your daughter is a s**t, she is characterless. Y unable to bear all those insults, commits suicide. 3. (Inspired by one of my favourite Quoran's work) In India, we don't see the qualities that a girl possess with her. We care about : can she cook, was she having a boyfriend before this proposal?? And most important: about her “character certificate” i.e is she virgin?? On the first day of arrival of a bride, our neighborhood aunties ask the brides to sing. WTF is this? They think they are Anu Malik and brides have come for audition of Indian Idol. 4. We take pride in saying that the lowest divorce rate is ours, but we don't notice the amount of domestic violence that women face in their marriage. We fail to see the other side and then expect brides to adjust. This needs to change. I'm sick of this mindset of ours. We might achieve Clean India, but will we ever ever Clean Indian Mindset?? Think…..

I was 10 or 12 years old. He used to come to my house once or twice a year. Sometimes he even stays for a few days. One time he came and he told my mom that he is tired and his legs are paining. My mom told me to go and give him a leg massage. It was around 11 in the night, my parents were sleeping in a different room. I was giving him a leg message for almost 30 minutes, then he asked me to give a thigh massage. I started doing the thigh massage. After some 10–15 minutes he took my hands and kept in his inner wears. I was shocked I didn’t understand what’s happening. Before I could think about it, he held my face and kissed me on my lips. I was shivering, he came up and he held my penis tightly. I was breathing heavily and I was sweating. I was not getting what’s happening with me but I understood that whatever is happening, is not correct. Somehow I dragged myself in one corner and I told him that I need to go to the washroom. He asked me to go and come back soon. I ran towards my parents but I didn’t have the understanding to explain the same to my parents. I kept quiet and slept in the hall. Next morning he was staring at me and he was smiling. I thought to tell all this to my parents but I didn’t know how to explain them. He was a very reputed man. My parents literally use to worship him and his thoughts. I too use to respect him a lot. Not even in my wildest dreams, I have imagined him like this. I was numb, I was sad. I use to feel lonely. I use to cry whenever I find myself alone. One day I decided to tell this to my sister. I took her to the roof and I told her everything. After hearing my story she believed me but she told me to not tell this to anyone. I lost my confidence and after that, I never told this to anyone. First Few months were difficult but slowly I forgot everything and I started living a normal life. A few years later I saw one episode of Satyamev Jayate (TV Series 2012– ) on Child abuse. That day I understood what happened to me, I was crying like a baby until the end of the episode. I thought to tell everything to my mom but I felt now it is too late. He still used to come to my home but I started avoiding him. Somehow I always escaped from him and he never gets a chance to touch me again. A few days back he was at home and the same incident happened with my cousin. I was at home and when I saw my cousin I observed that he is not feeling comfortable. I took him in a corner and asked the reason. Firstly, he was not telling anything but later after forcing a bit, he told me the same story which I told my sister a few years back. After hearing all this again, I got so angry. Somehow I got that lost courage, I took my cousin with me and I told everything to my mom. I know that if my cousin will tell this to her, she will believe me too. I told her what happened to me a few years back. She was not able to digest this fact but she believed. I am relieved that now I have told everything to my parents. But I am not happy because my parents didn’t take any action. They just stopped talking to him and they asked me to do the same. Now, I hope he won’t come to my house but what if he will do the same with other children. Neither my cousin’s parents nor mine is in favour of FIR. But wherever I go in a family relation or family function I share this with my other cousins and alert them about that animal. I wish one day I will see more courageous and aware society. So, people like me can come out and at least do the FIR. My parents didn’t support me but I wish you guys will listen to your children. I hate it when I see news about child abuse. I hate it when I see a child in depression due to abuse. I hate it when a child kills himself due to depression. We have to take this issue seriously and enforce strict rules. Childhood memories are unforgettable but we don’t want our children to have such memories. Think about it. Thank You for Reading Guys. I can’t share his name but still, I am feeling more relieved. I want you guys to promise yourself that you will educate your child about child abuse and you will always listen to your child. Cheers for Children and Childhood. If you too had such bitter experiences and you need someone to share. Feel free to share with me. Just don’t keep this negativity within you. It will destroy you. Don’t Kill yourself, Kill the Depression. Keep reading and Keep Learning. Thank you so much for your time. See you soon. Manish Raj Srivastav (मनीष राज श्रीवास्तव)

I hate it when I say something bizarrely stupid in front of people and that haunts me while sleeping even after a weekI hate it when someone asks when what happened and a tiny drop of tear trickles down my face followed by a deluge. Getting vulnerable is the last thing I would want to doI hate it when sometimes I have no idea what gnaws me from within. When I couldn’t figure out what makes me feel so hollow inside, you just don’t feel right, there are myriads of sounds doing rounds in my head and a certain kind of restlessness creeps inI hate it when I disappoint myself , when I don’t make enough efforts that should put in and hate it more when even after realizing it I behave like a slothI hate it when I couldn’t say the right things at the right time and I later think about very creative comebacks that I should have usedI hate it when I realize that there are certain things which I have to let go. There are things beyond our control and we just can’t do much about it

I am an Indian, and my country is a place known for its diversity. Our country is beautiful, where people are united irrespective of language, religion, place or culture. If I praise my country, it won’t be enough from my writing. But I hate it when people go for a candle march when a girl is raped. Because they think it will bring some change in our people, system and law. I hated it when people joined from far corners of India, so that they will fight against rape. Is something wrong with me? Maybe, because I don’t see results. 2 days back I read a news that an 8 month old infant was raped by some drunkard. Where is the candle march? What happened to our unity against rape? Everything gets faded, because we have short term memory.  I hate it, when people do drama about their supreme caste and fight for something which happened thousands of years ago. They fight for their pride, they fight to satisfy their ego. Maybe they are right and I fail to understand their fight. But I hate it, when they leave people on the road dying. I hate it, when they are not bothered to give food to poor people even when they belong to their caste. But they fight.  I hate it when people are involved in spreading hatred. I hate myself that I am watching everything, but refuse to take any action. Because maybe I am waiting for something bad to happen to me, and then I will take the pain of moving my ass. Because, responsibility comes from each individual. If I don’t take responsibility, then I have no right to expect from anyone. #I Hate It.

“I hate it when you don't listen to me, Sanju!” Screamed his mom. “How many times have I told you not to pick up strays and get them home. Now go, get rid of it somewhere and wash your hands…change your uniform too.” Sanju looked at his new buddy. A tiny, feeble 3 weeks old pup, resting on his shoulders. It's soft ears brushed against his as it woofed at him as if telling him it's ok. “Maa, I want to keep him. I promise, I will get the first rank this year.” “Won't you listen? They could be carrying diseases. Look, how dirty it is. Who knows where it has been? And how will you study with a pet in the house?” “Maa, please just this one time. I promise I will get the first rank this year. If I don’t, you can give him to an animal shelter and I won't say anything. But please, can we keep him? You don't have to worry about him, I'll take care of him. Maa, please…” “Hmm….ok but only after you clean him well. If I ever catch you spending time with him instead of studying, I’m calling the animal rescue group.” “Thank you, Maa! You are the best.” That day, Sanjay finally got the sibling he always wished for.

I hate it when someone does politics with me. Yeah, you heard it right. I always love my work. I'm honest with my work. Whatever I do, I make sure I do it sincerely. It's been almost two years that I've worked with my current company. The workplace and atmosphere are absolutely phenomenal, and everything is good. Indeed it’s a dream company !! So far I had given three IJP's in last 12 months, and each day the competition was getting so tough. Being a commerce student I'm always weak at logical reasoning and aptitude tests. I had failed in all those first three attempts. Later, I decided that I would struggle a lot and it's now “Do or die” situation for me. Because I knew this is gonna be the last IJP for next 10 months, and I'll have to clear this at any cost. Struggled a lot and spent extra hours at the office almost for two months. Day arrived for IJP test. Did my best and was confident enough that this time I would bring my name in the list. A few days later,  I was so happy reading this. I told my mom that soon I'll be flying, and I'll make them all proud once I'm done with this assignment. Three months later one of my colleagues, Raj, called me to check whether I'm coming for the project, because they had already gone, and I didn't even know. I told him that I know nothing about this, and I would talk to our boss. I went to our boss and asked the reason for not informing me. He said he didn't know anything because it was senior's decision to not to send me. I was crying from inside. I didn't utter a word and laughed at myself for being such an honest employee. Moral : I know I don't deserve this. I have taken this incident as a good lesson, because I know soon something great is coming towards me that I deserve !! Pic source : My gallery Peace !!

I hate it when… My fragile heart never learns to move on. Love had never done me much good…or maybe it was the other way round? I always found a reason to let go, “nobody understands me” “How can he accept these flaws of mine…” the list was endless. And each time I saw a good relationship fold and crumble, I would run back into my cold walls, its dark embrace enveloping me, and cry “Love what have you done to me?!!” I hate it when… All I ever seem to be is the victim. Victim of circumstance, victim of anger, victim of distrust. I am always the effect of someone else’s vile plot…can I never be cause? How can I find love when my mind’s cold reign has made my tender heart prisoner…prisoner of my own creation? I hate it when… He makes me feel like I can be free. How can I escape this dark universe I have come to call home? How can I step out of my walls, into the light and not shrink from its brightness? And yet he says I can. I think I may have found something, MAYBE not love, but surely not hate…with him, I do not feel like a victim. With him, I can take the risk of showing someone, for the very first time, all that I am, with all my flaws. With this person, I found hope, hope for a chance at happiness. And hope that my next line will begin with, “I love it when…”

“I hate it when people look at me with sympathy in their eyes” Shivni told to his father. Her father got worried and asked “What happened beta” “They were looking at me and my leg when I was walking.” She was having problem in her leg due to polio. Her father got furious but at the same time he was worried about the depression his daughter will get into. He went to her and told in a firm voice “You’re my fighter Shivni, remember one thing people will pull you down by laughing at you or showing sympathy but you have to rise up show you are better then them. No one can pull you down except yourself, reach to such a level that people admire you rather than sympathising with you.” “Madam, Tea” suddenly a peon interrupted her thoughts trail about the conversation she had with her father 9 years ago. She came to the present and had a look at her nameplare “Dr. Shivni Chopra” She thought in her mind “Papa, I completed your dream. Now people do admire me and my work.”

I hate it when the sprawling sky lacks colors and gorgeous designs. It irks me to find it painted with a solitary white crayon sometimes. I miss the steel azure that shrouds it. I long to discover stunning castles in the puffs of cottony clouds floating carelessly. I have believed for a long, long time that there's a bewitching fountain in the sky and we call it rain. I'm amazed by the delicacy with which the raindrops hit the parched ground. I am enchanted by the burnt orange in the evening sky. I find solace in the creamy vanilla hue of the twilight, and a streak of agony in the soft purple of the arriving dusk. The bright yellow yarn stitched against the sky in a beautiful circle tells me the stories of the endless space. The sky has so much color in it. Enough to create a parallel world filled with magic and color. If only skies could talk, I would ask its rainbows the place from where they borrow their arresting hues. I hate it when I fail to find colors. I hate it when the skies fail to bewitch me.

A young guy of 21 years age, having muscular body; being a son of millionaire dad; having most of the things in his life showing off everything he has; from his muscular body; his luxurious cars; the number of hot- girlfriends he has, everything. Till this part of story; it’s okay, I don’t have any problem with that. It is his life. But, the moment his show off habit turns into the habit belittling others or pulling others down. The moment he tries to make realize other people that, only he is the one. The Superior. The invincible. The greatest. Few days back my eyes saw similar kind of guy trying to belittle a poor-old man, only because he wanted to satisfy his own ego in-front of his so-called hot girlfriend. And his girlfriend was also enjoying that. I Hate it. When someone tries to bring others’ self respect down, only because he has something which others’ don’t have. They forget the humanity. I hate it. The minute you think you have the right to belittle othersbecause you think you’re better than them is the sameminute you’ve proven you’re worse. - Joanne Crisner

“I hate it when you come late.” Stuti said while lying on the hospital bed. “I am sorry” Spoke Ashrey with a blissful smile on his face. “How's your leg now? Does it still feel the pain?” Ashrey enquired in a concerned tone. “Its all right now. It was just a small accident.” Stuti spoke gently. “You call it a small accident! That truck would have left you all shattered.” Ashrey spoke with a heavy griefey tone. “Will you relax now. Chalo sing my favourite song now. I want to listen.” Blushed Stuti. “Now? Are you kidding me Stuti!” What if someone comes inside this room?” “Then they will get to know how superb you sing.” Stuti blushes again. “You will never change know. Okey, here it goes.” ‘Zehnaseeb, zehnaseeb, tujhe chahu beintehasah.. zehnaseeb'.. “Sing my favourite line know, don't skip the song now.” Stuti poked Ashrey. “Will you ever listen to me? Okey, but just once huh.” Spoke Ashrey in a hurry. ‘Hua amir, dil gareeb, tujhe chahu beintehasha zehnaseeb'… “Wow, now I am feeling a bit better.” Stuti had a mile long smile on her gentle face. “Now come close to me, will you?” Said Stuti with a concerned look on her face. Listening this sentence, Ashrey got goosebumps as there was no assurance who will come inside the ward room. However, seeing Stuti lying in front of him as a helpless girl with a fractured leg was enough to ignite his deep passionate emotions for her. They both held each others hand and kept staring at each other like they are meeting for the last time in this life. Tears rolled down from Stuti's eyes like two pearls shining, coming out of a silent blue sea. Ashrey felt the same intense love for his bedridden beloved but kept his emotions hidden in his heart. Forgetting the whole world around, they lost in each others eyes, never to return back again. “Who is your friend beta?” A voice came from behind which shattered their fantasy world in seconds. It was none other than Stuti's mum. “He is my friend mumma. Meet Ashrey. He came to see me.” Stuti spoke half shivering. “Oh is it. Nice to see you beta.” Stuti's mum spoke in a humble way. However, she had understood the intense chemistry between both of them. “I should leave now. Good day aunty.” Ashrey spoke hiding his emotions and saw Stuti's saddened face which was clearly stating the pain of a temporary separation. Nevertheless, he spoke his heart out in his mind. “Get well soon Stuti. You dont know this but I have lost my sleep just thinking about you the whole night. You and only you I see, none other. Though, I can't be with you always but just remember one thing, whenever you close your eyes, you will see me standing in front of you, smiling. Hence remember, I am here only.” Ashrey

Let me try it in Rana’s style:- Story time: There was a poor farmer, he had some fields. He took a lot of effort in ploughing and watering the field. Then he seed the wheat in his fields. Every day he used to came to his fields to see his hardwork. After few months, his hardwork pay off and he see that golden colour which he wants to see. Now, why he did all these? just for two meals of a day? Yes,but more than that. It was those wheat, which we see in our plates as chapatti. I just wanted to say that it takes a lot of effort to before the food reach in our plate. And what we do? Just throw in dustbin? I hate it. I hate it when you don't realise someones effort .I hate it when you waste food.I hate it when you take someone's life by wasting your food.Think 100 times before doing this   925,000,000 Million people are hungry, 1,300,000,000 Billion tons of food is wasted.  3 Easy ways to kill a child: Take more than you can eat.Eat till you are full.Throw away the rest. In every 3.6 seconds, a child dies because of hunger. I don't like to waste anything. If any food left over from night, I used to consume them in morning. Even if i have any such kind of thoughts in my mind, my mom sense it and throws a “flying chappal” on me. Bottom line Love food, food are meant to be sharing, not for wasting. You waste life when you waste food. Thank you. -Uddhav yadav ❤️

I hate it when people love the things more than people, for everything their is an expiry date. Of course, we people will have that too. But the thing is when we love the things more, no person comes to you. But when you love the people, everything comes to you. We are in a society where, we can sell our kidney to buy an I phone, but we can’t donate that kidney for the needed. We waste the food in a rich restaurant but we can’t feed a child who is hungry on the roadside, we pay many dollars without bargaining in a shopping mall but we bargain for vegetables in the street. We apply loans for cars and houses but we will think when it comes to education of a girl. Seriously we are living in a society where we pay tax for sanitary pads but not for condoms. The world may invent new technology but it's still lagging in human relations. When we are going to die we only remember the people who are with us and the people who you loved but not what you earned and all the things in your house or anything else.

I hate it when I look at that particular Family photo of ours and not find myself in it!It is a damn sad situation. My papa,My role model,stands there,smiling.I know he wanted to stand next to ma,but that drama queen,my sister,desperately wanted to stand between them.Huh!!So much for ruining their simple pleasures.Still,his smile has a tinch of affection in it,which I've never seen leaving those lips. He is the best dad in the world,no matter what. I can't forget the day,when I returned home messing up my pre-models.I deserved a flogging,or atleast a huge scolding.But my papa,did neither.He just looked at me,and said that I could do better.I could see the hope in his eyes,and that single spark had me working hard to the pride of the school topper. “Let us give it for Kriti Bharadwaj,the School topper,and the best outgoing student for the year 2017–18!” The moment I heard the announcement,I felt a huge relief.I had not let my papa down.I looked at him,and there he was,beaming at me,urging me to go to the stage.His eyes reflected pride for his daughter. When I think of papa,I think of God.He never scolded me,never pressurised me,and never did he say a no.Maybe that was why we,I and my sister,grew up into very fine social beings. And,in the photo,there was my ma. My super cute and super sweet ma.The one who could never see me in pain,and the one who could hear each of my heartbeats.The one who could tell in a second if I am sad,and the one who was there with me in each and every walk of life. She wasn't much educated,but she was the coolest ma anyone could have.She knew what ‘13 Reasons why' was,as much as she knew about all of those crap saas-bahu soaps.She knew what the current fashion trend was,and we never had to worry about the outfits for every occasion.She taught us that god was a single force,and there was nothing that matters in religions and castes.And,God!How could I forget about her culinary skills?She was a GREAT cook!And a great dancer,a singer,and artist. And then comes that little miss perfect of mine.The great Shruti Bharadwaj,my sister.She came into our lives a lot late,I was so glad to know about her arrival when I was studying in class 8th.After her birth,she managed to charm each and everyone of us,and became our first priority.She’s a lot melodramatic.She wants the exact bag that her Didi has,and the exact sandals.She wants the TV remote for 24 hours of the day,and sleeps hugging her Didi like a bear.She wants that diary milk silk her Didi had got as a birthday gift,and wants that adorable doll or keychain,which she finds in a matter of seconds in that shop. Even though I'm not there,that family photo is my all-time favourite.But those heartless people,took it at the time when I was busy preparing for my JEE at Kota. I smile a little. Then,I move forward to adjust the garland on that photo and Light an incense stick in front of it. Why did you guys go leaving this girl behind?Papa,You never did anything without letting me know.Then,why did you decide to go without telling me,huh? Ma,I'm your baby na?Why didn't you tell me before deciding to go? Chhotti?Why did you go without giving Didi a kiss,baby?See,Didi had a large Chocolate in her bag to give to you.You could've atleast waited to devour it,na? I had planned to surprise you with my visit,so did you guys.You were coming to see me. To surprise me.Only that you didn't reach here,but the surprise did!It had such a great momentum,that I fainted at the very moment of receiving it. Was my life worthier than yours?Why did you have to go leaving me behind?What will my life become without your presence?Did you guys think about it before pranking me?I'm a total zero now.Zero emotions,Zero goals. I hate it when I look at that photo!How I wish I was in it!But you left without telling me na? Cheatercocks.. I hate it when all of your dear ones leave you in that one damned second! I hate being alone…

“I hate it when you always talk to him!” Rehan said, angrily. She was listening, peacefully, a smile over her face. “Why do you do that? You always ignore me, you always hug him, you always talk to him, when we eat, you always tell him what you did the whole day! Why do you give him all the attention?” Rehan said, venting out his anger. “Listen to me, baba…”she tried to interject. “What “listen to me”? I have had enough. I can't take it anymore. You always give him all the attention. For me, you are always busy, even when we are alone, you call him and start talking to him. You have no time for me.” “But…” she tried to speak, but Rehan didn't let her. “No. I won't listen anymore. I hate you. You don't love me!” “Ofcourse, I love you, but I love him, too,” she confessed. “You can't love both of us!” he retorted. “I can. Because I am your Mom, and his wife, both. I can love both of you,” Mom said, still smiling. Rehan was confused.  Yours, A Former Rehan.

“I hate it when we have to take this trip in every 75 years”, exclaimed the creature who was the driver of Halley’s Comet. The creature looked like this:-  He was the most experienced driver of Halley’s Comet. So, the Holy Duty of passing by the GOD’s planet was always awarded to him. He took off from his planet with several other companions. As they were about to reach the GOD’s planet, one of the companions asked, “Is it true that GOD lives here?” The Driver replied, “I believe so.” The Companion politely asked, “Has someone saw HIM? What does he look like?” The Driver was asked this question every time he was on this Holy Duty. And he knew the answer - “As quoted by the religious book of Halley, only a pure soul can enter the GOD’s planet and experience the almighty HEAVEN.” He continued, “Till then, we can just offer him our gratitude.” As the comet entered the GOD’s planet which looked like this -  All the companions on Halley’s Comet had the power to emit light from their heads. And that’s how they expressed their Gratitude.  One event - Two creatures - One had a scientific reason - One had a religious belief And the word “TRUTH” just lost its purpose.

“I hate it when you treat me like this. What do you think I am? A piece of shit?” Azeem didn’t respond. He stood there paralyzed, wondering why Pratima was losing her mind over something that’s not in her control. “I’m talking to you! Can’t you just respond?”, shouted Pratima. She was mad at him and he, obviously, was taking things lightly. Why can’t he understand, she thought. Well, she had to admit that this trait of his was what made her fall in love with him - he was carefree, easy-going and loved to live in the present. He would often mimic Shah Rukh Khan, enacting his dialogue, “Jiyo! Khush raho! Muskurao! Kya pata kal ho na ho”. She almost smiled as she remembered this but then quickly tried to shoo the thought away. It was different when they met years ago but he knows that she doesn’t like it anymore. We’ve got to think about the future. Why can’t he just… “Jiyo! Khush Raho!”, started Azeem, interrupting her thoughts. “Muskura..” “Please”, Pratima clenched her fists, raised it to her shoulders and slammed it on the table in front of her. “Don’t start this again”, she mouthed. “Azeem, please! Can you ever be serious in life? You know I love you. Don’t you want to marry me?” She took a deep long breath and continued, “Baby, my parents will never let this happen until we think of something.” For the first time, Azeem looked straight into her eyes and started walking towards her. He said, “Rati baby, don’t worry! I’ll take care of this. Trust me, hon.” He pulled her close and wrapped his arms around her. “I promise, tonight will be just fine. Go home and I’ll think of something.” Pratima rested her head on his broad chest and sighed. He let her relax, before he continued, “We will make this happen. Our parents know that our love for each other is bigger than their hatred for each other’s religion. They love their children, don’t they?” “I am scared, Azeem. I don’t want to lose you” “You will not”, he said but he wasn’t sure himself. He had invited them all over for dinner. His parents and her parents, together! A muslim family and a hindu family. Under one roof. He hadn’t taken it lightly. Not even once. He wanted to marry her. And for that, he was ready to do just about anything. And he had done precisely that. “Rati, let’s just go home and get ourselves ready for the evening.” He smiled as they parted. “And don’t forget to wear that orange silk saree, okay?” She smiled and nodded. With that, Pratima turned and left. As he saw her walk away, Azeem twisted his lips and smirked. Pratima was definitely in for a surprise tonight. Fingers crossed. Pratima had no idea that Azeem had been meeting her parents without her knowledge. They had had endless discussions, after they had finally agreed. So had his parents. He had walked this slippery slope and had triumphantly reached the top. “Sometimes, it is okay to lie”, he said it out aloud. “Don’t I love her?” And tonight is going to be the perfect. His plan worked! They were, after all, going to be engaged tonight! Surprise, Rati!

"I- I HATE IT WHEN YOU EAT MY UNDERWEAR AND MY TOYS, AND YOU EAT ALL MY FOOD! I HATE YOU!" The boy stomped for extra effect, making the 4 month old puppy shake and whimper at his humans anger. The boy ran to his room, crying and yelling as he kicked his bed and threw his stuffed animals at the wall. With every throw and kick he thought of the bad things puppy did. Like how she ate his ham sandwich yesterday, making the boy get grumpy at school and have a talk with the principal. Or last week, when the puppy ate 5 of his underwear making mommy and daddy yell for a long time about money. Even the first week the puppy came, she ate his special teddy bear when he let her borrow it. Tired, the boy plopped on his bed. She was a really bad puppy, maybe he did hate her. But then he thought about when she snuggled him during that thunderstorm. Or when puppy bit the boys big sister for trying to beat him up. Or how every time mommy and daddy fought, puppy would lick the boy and make him feel happy again. Tears streamed down the boys face, he was so mean to his puppy, and she was only a baby! What if she now hates him for saying that he hates her? The boy swung open his door to see puppy sitting there, tailing wagging and a big smile on her face. "I'm so sorry puppy, I don't hate you. I love you so so much!" He squeezed the puppy tightly in a hug as puppy tried her best to lick his tears away. "I love you puppy" And in that moment, the boy knew that his puppy loved him too.

I hate it when you tell me I can't join your club. "Sorry," you say. "This club is only for kids with brown eyes." My eyes are a rich jade green, bright and shimmering. "Sorry," you say. "This club is only for boys who like red and girls who like blue." I am a boy. Red is too hot, too angry for me. I prefer a calm, chilled blue. "Sorry," you say. "This club is only for kids who believe in dragons and unicorns." I see these majestic, elegant creatures etched into my picture book. I know they are not real. "Sorry," you say. "This club is only for kids who got a perfect score on the spelling test." I spelled three words wrong. I can read. I can write. I can't spell. "Sorry," you say. "This club is only for kids who are the captain of a sports team." I defend the soccer ball from the goal and boot it far away anytime it nears me. I jump higher than anyone to retrieve the rebounds. I listen. I take orders. "Mom, they wouldn't let me join their clubs at school," I said, over my afternoon snack of peanut butter cookies, green apples, and creamy milk. "It's okay," she told me. "It will be better as you get older." "Will it?" I asked. "Will it?"

“I hate it when I can't find my purse…ugh..,” Ritu’s hands were running through her bag. “Girl, You are holding up the queue!!” cashier was angry at her for holding the line at his shop. She looked back only to find a guy standing behind her. “But there is only one..” “Even if there is only one or none, a queue is a queue!” The cashier was infuriated. “I thought a queue was not a queue. Thanks for the info. Shall I write it down as it might be asked in my tomorrow's quiz?” she laughed. “Pay me now or get lost!” The cashier's anger limit got busted by Ritu's joke. “I must have lost the purse.” “Tell me the details. I will call you if I find it,” The cashier asked. “I purchased the purse from here, yesterday. It's a common black one. There was ₹500 in it,” she told him the details. “If my father came to know about it..” she was terrified. “Hey, is this your purse?” Ritu turned back to find a man holding her purse. “Oh my god, thank you so much.” “My pleasure,” he smiled. “Here is the money and keep the change,” he said to the cashier and walked away with a smirk. Her phone rang. “Ritu, you forgot your purse here,” her mom said. Astounded, she ran out of the shop to find the guy, she called him loudly, “hey, it's not mine.” “It’s a new one. Keep it,” he waved at her with a wink!

Maira: Daksh, it’s your turn to do the dishes and then maybe we could cuddle afterwards? Daksh: Whatever, Maira. Not right now. Maira: Hey what’s up? You don’t look in a good mood today. Daksh: It’s nothing. I have a lot of work today. I’ll just go in the study and work. Maira: Tell me, no? What’s bothering you? Daksh: Nothing. Maira: Hey, tell me. Daksh: MAIRA PLEASE! I TOLD YOU I HAVE WORK TO DO. CAN YOU PLEASE GET OFF MY BACK FOR ONCE? Maira: You know what? I hate it when you take me for granted. I am tired of you treating me like a doormat. We are done. *Maira leaves the room*  Scrolling down his Instagram feed, he saw her picture. His heart skipped a beat. She looked beautiful in her engagement gown. Gulping the rest of scotch, he wondered whether things would have been different if he had done those dishes that day.

“I hate it when you call me your best friend,” shouted Anand at Laya. The smile on her face slowly faded as she slipped into her memories. They lived at the same place. They studied together in the same school. He was her only best friend. He could recognise her mood in just one glance. He never failed to get her favourite candy every day they met. She never opened up to others. There were no secrets between them. They studied in different colleges, yet they helped each other in studies. Who else can understand better how it feels to be an orphan than an orphan? That moment she realised, after all, people aren't same even if they have similar face cuts and share same birth date. Only she knew how badly she needed a friend after her best friend Advait's demise. After that day, she never saw Advait in Anand.

“I hate it when you eat away all my chocolates. At least take my permission before eating them.” “Take your permission? Mom bought those for both of us. Why do I have to ask? Mom! Mom, come here!” “Oh yeah. And you already had your share. And now you want to eat mine too. Call mom. Boo!” “Boo!” Both of them leave the room. “I shared my ice cream with you. Give that back and I will buy you chocolates,” she yelled from the hall. “That ice cream? That was like 2 months back! And that was stale. It must be down the gutter. Go eat that. You are already so gross. Ew!” “How dare you tell that!” She headed to the hall too to bash her sister. Both of them stand face to face. Woah. “What are you girls fighting for? You are sisters. Remember?” That was Dad. And what does he have in his hand? Chocolate. Half eaten. “Dad! How could you….” At least they united at the end. Don't ask what Dad had to do after that. Cheers!

I hate it when people still talk about religion, caste and communities. I hate it when someone values a thing more than a person. I hate it when kind people are ill treated even after seeking their help. I hate it when rich people waste money on flamboyant parties and events. I hate it when people believe in fake spiritual leaders. I hate it when we speak about democracy, but also take money to vote. I hate it when we don't tolerate corruption but we often bribe when we have situations to face. I hate it when good people are silent where their voice is needed. I hate it when the weather isn't good. I hate it when the food isn't tatsty. I hate it when my mother puts me on a job. I hate it when parents compare children with others. I hate it when I have to wait. I hate it when if I have low battery in my mobile. I hate it when the data speed is low. I hate it when people hurt me. I hate it when some people don't understand me. I hate, I hate , I hate … The list is endless. It is easy to hate something or someone, but it takes much more to love someone or accept something. There will be a number of reasons to hate. Inspite of all that, we still have a small portion that is very vulnerable to love and kindness. It is only with the heart one can see rightly. What is essential is invisible to the eye.

Age: 5 I hate it when you don’t play with me. 'Mommy,…?’ ‘Wait honey, I need to get this items listed on the grocery list’. His mother ignored him. ‘Dad?’ ‘Mm?’ His father barely looked up from his phone. Age: 10 ‘Mom. Dad. You both are coming to the annual sports day right?’ ‘Sure’. They nodded absent mindedly. He won three medals that day. Neither of his parents showed up. ‘I hate it when you prioritize work over me’. He shouted at them that day. His parents ignored him. Age: 13 ‘Your son is misbehaving again’. His teacher called up the parents. ‘Is that so? Why?’ Asked the father. ‘I hate it when you’re not there for me when I need you.’ They went home silently, with mixed emotions. Age: 16. ‘I hate it when my parents ignore me all the time.’ His suicide note read. This time his parents didn’t. But he was no longer alive to see them wailing beside his coffin.

I hate it when,she pulls up the sheets over her head and pretends to sleep for long .I know she is awake and she knows I am waiting just for her to get up I am making sure to trouble her enough for the sleep to leave ,but look at her she keeps pretending.Its morning already I can hear the newspaper guy tuck the newspaper by the door,the milkman dropped the packets of milk too. I’ll try again and I know secretly she loves this morning exercise between her and me.There I see her moving and lifting the edge of her blanket to just peep and see where I am, and I jump at this opportunity and grab the blanket and pull it so tight and win this tug of war.Finally she is up and movesr hands in her hair to tie them up now she looks at me intently and hold me tight and then the best part ..she holds me tight and says, “Good Morning BO” lets fix up breakfast for you and I jump to the thought of it and say, “Wuff Wuff” ………..A morning in a dogs life :)

“I hate it when he falls asleep texting” Neshi mumbled as she went to sleep. She woke up with 3 missed calls and 14 messages. Two messages were from her best friends but the other 12 were from him. Oh him. When she opened the messages, her eyes got wider and her smile brighter than ever. 'How can someone be so sweet and write all these things right after waking up?’ she wondered. A bus could hit her that day but the smile wouldn't leave her lips. 5 years later… She wakes up and doesn't even check her phone anymore. She knows it's only going to hurt her more. They both are together and still not together. They both have changed and evolved but there's a difference between them: She's still madly in love and he's not. . . . A change is not worth it if it's only going to kill everything around.

An adult doesn’t realize when their child of a different gender shouldn’t be in your locker room. When I go to my uncle’s pool my uncle used to bring in my cousin Andi to pee first. She was like 2. I was 7.  Because, I changed her diapers and she was naked 2/3 of the time anyway. Fast forward 4 years. Andi Is 6 now.  6 is not 2 or 3 or 4. 6 is aware of stuff and curious. Not sexual. But curious. She just waltzes in whenever, but I always seemed to be either showering or changing. Everyone thought Andi was just their little baby but when she’d come in and I was alone she CLEARLY came right over to look at my penis (only has baby sister). Unashamed, 2 feet away, staring. I am almost 12. Just barely changing. Last week I was just pre-showering and in walks Andi, pulls her bottoms down to pee, then walks over to me, looks for a bit, then informs me my penis is still small. Her dad’s is a lot bigger. Is it ever going to grow? And she walks out. Thanks Andi. That’s the last time you’ll be seeing it btw. You can ask any questions to me personally.

Aanya- “ Is she really visiting us so soon? Or you are kidding again, Mom ?” Mom- “ Aanya, Go straight to the kitchen. You promised to bake a cake for grandma's birthday.” Aanya- “ Coming, Mom” *Aanya collecting all the requisites runs to the kitchen all excited for baking her grandma's surprise.* An hour later. Mom- “ Are you done, honey ?” Aanya- “Almost done, at what time is she coming ?” *Phone rings* Mom- “ Aanya, come to me. There's something I want to tell you.” *Looking at her mom, Aanya instantly knew what it was all about* Aanya- “ I hate it, Mom. She does this to me every time. I hate her for treating me this bad. Am I always supposed to suffer because of her grandson? When will she start loving me?” *Runs back to her room sobbing*

“I hate it when you smile at those random girls .”she said while poking elbow in his stomach . “Wooooooh ,chill girl I just replied she smiled first , I just showed my good manners .”he replied to add fire to her anger .“ I m afraid I don’t kill you for showing your good manners .” she walked ahead faster . He had to run to catch her , he went and hold her from back “ Stupid you will always be my reason to smile .”“ Huh ,leave me .”she pushed him . “Arrey I love to see you angry baby then when I try to make you happy and its my hobby to irritate you , I like to see you jealous this makes me feel that you love me so much and I toh already love you only idiot .”he said hugging her again . This time she could not resist and melted away in his arms . They walked down the road happily with hand in hand , promising each other about spending their life together .But who knew what lies in the lap of destiny . “Look at her she is perfect for you , Hey listen na do you remember that gym girl who use to stare you alot , why don’t you ask her out .”she said lying on that bed , room no. 108 of City Hospital while he sat in front on the chair holding her hand and tears in his eyes . She was diagnosed cancer on the last stage she hardly had few hours. She was in hospital for more than a week now . She knew he can not live alone he is so careless so she wanted him to be with someone before she closes her eyes . Whereas he just wanted her together and forever but now this was not possible . She had to leave , he had to live . She again started “ say na , you use to watch every girl here and there . Now you don’t have any to be with you . Idiot I don’t have much time .” He pressed her lips with his hand and hugged her crying like a baby “ You promised to be there no matter what .” She rubbed his back and said ,“ I m sorry I m breaking the promise . Come on now ..” she closed her eyes , her hand went down . Yes she left . That was the last day he saw or smiled at a girl . After that he never raised his head for any girl . He never smiled at any girl in fact not at anyone . She just not broke the promises rather took his heart away too . Now he hated it when any girl passed by smiled at him . Thanks for giving your precious time to read my words .

I hate when people display peculiar physiology, sociology and psychology of Jumping Queues. For sure even you have come across this, especially in India. (This discussion is limited to attitude and behaviour of people).  Place, Time, Date, Person, doesn’t really matter to them in order to execute this Jumping Syndrome. We indeed find them Everywhere! Everywhere! The door next petty shop, you will go to buy milk. Cashier is busy taking money from another customer. Here comes this Jumping Syndromist literally jumping on you, to pay for that Parle- G biscuit he bought.You stood there for an hour waiting for “Darshana” in that new temple. He is exactly next to you wanna go faster than you and earn some trophy.No, No, they don’t fail to jump in local transportation while you getting-down and getting-in.You have gone to buy veggies, there they are! List just goes On and On.In a nation of a billion people, there is no escaping queues. We find ourselves in one every day - whether to board the flight or if we are less fortunate to fetch water from a municipal tap. In fact, I have seen folks appeared to be well-educated doing this. There are variety of “line cutters” some comes with good reasons and others without. Come on its time to reduce it at least.

To my Crush, I hate it when you said “NO, GO FIND SOMEONE ELSE” without listening to me even after knowing all my feelings for you just because your friends told you that I am a bad guy. Vibh, All I want is a normal conversation. To my Crush’s Friends, I hate it when you judge me without any knowledge and brain. I don’t know what you say to her, I really don’t care but next time, BEWARE. To my Parents, I hate it when you compare me with some of your colleagues or relatives children when either they got placed abroad or working for some MNC. From myself,I hate it when I am not peaceful from inside but I have to be peaceful in front of people. To the ’n’ people, I hate it when people have zero knowledge but they behave like intelligent. (only for showoff) To the Readers here, I hate it when people likes the post on Quora and don’t upvote it. Thanks for reading.

“I hate it when I open my gallery and find so little pictures of us. Why don't you click more of them?” He asked sadly. His girlfriend, from over 2000 kilometres, smiled. “ Why don't you click them instead?” She asked. “Yaar I completely forget to click them when I'm with you. When I go back, I regret.” “Isn't this the proof of our strong love? Forgetting the world whenever we're together? We don't capture memories baby, we create them instead.” She told him. On the other side, a tear rolled down his cheeks, as he heard that, and simply realised that Long distance relationships are tough, but with the right person, it's all worth the wait.

1. “It was her fault, she shouldn’t have went to that crowded place” “It was her fault, she was drunk.”“It was her fault, she was wearing way too revealing clothes” “It was her fault, she was roaming around the city with a guy at midnight”. “It was her fault, she was fighting back for herself, she should have given up.” “It was her fault, she should have surrendered herself in front of the rapists.” ………………………………………………………………………………………………………….. Somewhere outside the ICU, the parents of an 8 month old were thinking of what was their daughter’s fault, that she had to go through this. I hate it when people won’t stop victim blaming. It’s just so depressing, what’s happening out in the world, I know we can’t stop all of that at once but we can at least stop victim blaming.If anyone out in this world is to blame for the rapes is the person who rapes, the rapists and not the victim. We should stop victim blaming. Why?Because it kills the person suffering from the pain. Because it punctures the hopes of ever getting justice for themselves. Because it is never their fault!  2. “ Is desh ka kuch nhi ho sakta ” (“Nothing good can happen in this country”) the man said , spitting on the road. ” ye neta log apna pet bharna kam kare , tab kuch ho na “ (these curropt politicians should stop filling their stomach with money), another man said , while taking bribe. ” Desh ka bhavishya khatre mei dikhae de rha” (The future of this country is in danger), said the third one while smoking in a public area. I hate it when such incredible people say such ironic things As Gandhiji said, Be the change you want to see in this world. :)  3. I hate it when people scream and shout at their parents, just because now they have grown up!  4. Its not that no one asked me‘ how are you ‘ ,Its just that no one really wanted to know … Its not like no one said” I miss you ” ,Its just that no one had time to do … Its not that no one praised my looks” you are beautiful” they said ,Its just they laughed when I turned my back… Its not that no one took stand for me” hey , I trust you ” ,Its just that no one actually did… Its not that no one pleaded me“ don’t leave , I need you ” ,Its just that no one wanted me to stay… Its not that no one confessed” I love you ”Its just that it was not ‘love’ & I was not the ‘you’ Its not that no one really said” Don’t worry , I’m here with you ” ,But its just that when in need no one held my back.. I hate it when people don’t mean what they say, when their actions defers from what they say!  P.S : All of these, were posted here on my blog : Stories from my diary ❤  Love!-Unnati :)

I am a Teacher. I teach Physics to JEE and NEET aspirants. Whenever someone comes to me for counseling or asking about my education, there is a moment of pity which always comes up. I hate it when they ask me about my degree college and make grief-stricken faces at my answer. 3 years ago, I had this conversation with a student. Them - Sir, you are a great teacher. You have taught a lot to our child. He always praises you and tells us that you are his role model. Me - (humbly accepting the fact) There is nothing like that. It is your ward's hard work and dedication. We just show the path. Them - That's so nice of you. BTW sir, from which IIT did you say you have a degree from? We will send him to the same one. Me - (realizing what is going to happen next) I am not an IITian. I am from GEC, Ajmer. I hope he gets into the best of the IITs according to exam performance.  ( I could notice their face growing pale) Them - (astonished like hell) Oh! We thought you are an IITian. How can you so teach so well when you are not one of them? (the student knew this fact about me but parents were dumbstruck) Me - (I could somehow notice the respect fading) Well, I hope he gets through the best college of the world so that he or she doesn't get to face this moment. (a moment of introspection and pride or a moment of grief, I decide) Last year the same student’s father visited me for the admission of his second child. I greeted him as I usually do and asked about his elder son’s college performance and well being. He told me that he couldn't get into any IIT, NIT or even a government college. He is in a private college near their home. He also told me that he wants to get into teaching field after he finishes his course and that I am the one who he looks after for any help. See, I really hate all this. I really do. But I offered a helping hand and told him to wait for 2 more years. He might get into an IIT via GATE. He can join coaching later on when he becomes an IITian. His father literally broke and was sorry about his behavior in the past. I wasn't feeling proud of this. I was sad. I hate it when someone breaks down bad like this in front of me. His younger son will appear for JEE this year. I hope he gets through so that he doesn't face the same situation. Maybe his father must have felt the same. Maybe. Maybe. P.S. I still face this. But I am a pro now. I face it with utmost humility and I have better answers.

I hate it when you said that you'd come to see me but you didn't. Maybe, the party songs were too loud to hear your phone ringing. I hate it when you had a heart to heart conversation with me and I vent in front of you about my childhood memories, my love for stars and moon, my vulnerabilities only to allow you to mock at me. Maybe, the conversations you had with others were too interesting to forget and now you're comparing ours with those. I hate it when you want to see my magazine-like beauty when I feel amazing draped in my unconventional beauty. Maybe, the lights out there are too bright for your eyes to look at the real me. I hate it when you call me up instantly on any misfortune happening, or when sadness wraps you, and then you forget my presence in your most delighted days. Maybe, the smiles and best wishes of those around you are too warm to neglect and look for me, for once. I hate it when. . . Who cares?
