I hate it when she smiles. She has her mother’s smile. I hate it when she laughs. She has her mother’s laugh. And I hate it when her eyes twinkle with the pure joy of living, like her mother used to every day of her life. I hate her perfect image of the woman I loved. But at the same time I can’t live with out her. She’s the one last piece of my wife on this earth. Maybe it’ll be tonight, when the hatred inside me will overcome how much I love her, just long enough to do irreversible damage. Maybe it’ll be tomorrow. Maybe next year. But it will happen. I can’t get lucky forever. It seems like an eternity that I stand next to her bed, crying, and laughing. I have to kill her but I can’t live without her. I guess we’ll have to go down together

“I hate it when you don't pay attention to my needs!” Annemarie stressed, tugging on her hair to release her pent-up frustration. Hart lit a cigarette, rolling his eyes at his girlfriend's rant. They'd been there before, and would go there as long as they were together. He took a drag. “See, there you go again. Do you even know what I just said?” She exploded, stomping her foot in petulance. “Does it really matter?” Hart said nonchalantly, puffing the smoke from his lips and putting the cigarette out with his thumb. “I'm leaving. I can't do this anymore.” Annemarie picked up a bag with food and clothing. Hart just watched. “You'll be back!” Hart called, and the small apartment vibrated as Annemarie slammed the door.  She was back in a few hours, dropping the bad by the door. She crawling back into the bed and wrapped her arms around Hart's waist, all with silent tears making their way down her face. She would always come back, at least until she didn't have the strength left to leave.

“I hate it when you go to bed without settling the dispute between us”, she mumbled to herself, snuggling under the blanket and wiping the tears standing at the edge of her eyes. Not a word did he speak and curled under the other blanket lying next to her, but, without facing her. “I told him innumerable times, I hate to sleep over fights or arguments, yet he turns deaf ear towards my emotions”, she thought to herself, pulling the blanket over her face and rubbing her red cheeks off her dripping tears. Not a movement from him, he seemed to be unwavered with all happening around. Unable to sleep and withheld the erupting emotions inside her, she turned to left only to find the space beside her empty. “Must have gone to other room to sleep, why so furious?” she wept, her heart filled with agony. “He doesn’t love me anymore”, she cried to herself shutting her eyes close and tight. After ten minutes, she felt fingers running through her hair and a warm hand holding her hand. She is half way into opening her eyes when he placed a gentle kiss on her forehead. This time, her cheeks turned red but not because of tears. “You always make me cry”, she said, innocence engulfing all over her face. “You need energy to cry and fight with me, so have some food at first”, he quipped taking the morsel of food into his hands to feed her. “I don’t feel like eating”, she brushed aside his hand turning her head side wards in sulky manner. “If only you eat, will I eat too,” he responded moving nearer to her. “You had a party with your friends in the evening, right? Didn’t you eat and come home?” she questioned in amusement. “No, I wanted to have dinner with you, so I came home early.” he replied, running his hands gently through her hair. She melted at his response and couldn’t hold her tears. But then she continued….. No more talking he uttered, grabbing her neck and kissed her hard on lips choking her words. As he with drew back, she blushed in happiness , together, they enjoyed food, amidst silly jokes and giggles. “I promise to never allow you to sleep with disturbance,” he smiled taking her into his arms and kissed on her cheeks. Hugging each other tight, they snuggled under a blanket and slept in peace the whole night, cuddling one another.

Raj and me have planned to buy groceries in nearby supermarket and left home with a check list in our hand. As the supermarket is on other side of main road and we had to wait patiently after seeing Red signal. Soon we were joined by other padestrians waiting for the green signal ,so that we can carefully walk through the zebra crossings . But in no time we noticed that two persons went crossing the road without caring traffic signal and trying to manage busy traffic putting them and speeding vehicles in danger. After waiting for couple of minutes as green signal was given ,all of us could safely cross the road. Raj turned to me and said “I hate it when people break the traffic rules, as a result putting them and others in great trouble” I replied “ Yeah , I agree with you,be happy that at least we were following traffic rules”. Thank you. S P Reddy

I hate it when you don't have your food, you know how I feel when you don't eat. She: Yes. But… He: No, I am not listening to you. I am ordering food for us. You are already hurt and in pain, as adamant as you can be. You have decided to stay and not go back home. Now atleast listen to me and have food. She: I don't want to go, we are meeting after such a long time. It was just an accident, it doesn't pain that much. Please I want to be with you. He: (teary eyed and trying to be strong) Don't say a word about pain. Look at you, your leg is bleeding, hands are bruised and swollen and you even knocked your head. You should stop driving you know for a while. I can't see you getting hurt almost every month. She: ( Adamant as she can ever be just to spend time with him and challenging her driving skills) You know this was not my fault. I know how you feel about these series of accidents. I will try to be more careful from now onwards. Besides we have also been to the hospital now. The doctor has treated my wounds and also examined me for any serious injuries. I am fine. I will take rest don't worry. Please stay with me for now. It has been two months already since we met. (Puppy eyes and a cute face always works) He: ( hiding the pain and giving up) I know this was not your fault, it was an accident. You have to be careful though. Stop making these puppy faces. I love you. All this just to be with me. This is the last time I am listening to you. We are having food and then heading straight to your home. I will drive you home and drop your scooty in sometime. No more arguments.( Firmly holding hands) She: ( Grinning from ear to ear. Forgot about the pain while in his company, thinking how lucky she is to have him by her side. She hates to see him upset because of her but his presence is magical.) He: Hey! You zoned out? Stop smiling like an idiot and tell me what will you eat? She: Oh! Whatever you order. I am fine. I love you. He: I know :) ( The food arrives after a while till then both of them sitting silently not wanting to let go of each other and the little time they get to spend.) She: I can't eat. My hands are paining. He: I know. I'll help you. ( He fed her with his hands thinking how she behaves like a child, even though she is in pain but won't say a word just to have this little time with him. ) She: I'm done. Thank you. ( They keep staring each other saying not a word but feeling the happiest.) He: ( Breaking the silence) Let's go. I know you can spend all day with me. You need rest now. I promise to see you soon. She: Very soon. ( and she leans her head on his shoulders holding him tightly from behind on his bike and he safely drops her home).

‘I hate it when he does this to me…..’ Darkness was ready to engulf a few remaining rays of sunlight. Neha stood on her balcony, adjusting herself on the railing she watched the birds flying back to their nest. Her brown eyes were now shimmering. Not because of the sun rays, but because the waters in her eyes reflected the light. Her conscience was fighting a raging war between optimism and pessimism. ‘Maybe he’s really busy…. Or maybe he’s intentionally avoiding me……’ Now, tears refrained from remaining in her eyes and rolled down her cheeks. She had no other option but to force herself to stop crying and get back to work. She completed household chores with a smile on her face but the pale face told an opposite story. Before going to bed she tried again to contact him. But again… ‘Hey there, this is Aryan, please leave a message and I will get back to you as soon as possible. Thank you’ Later that night her sleep was interrupted by two pings on her phone. First message: AM-XYZ bank ‘dear customer, 500 Canadian dollars are deposited in your account’ Second message: Hii Mumma, sending some portion of my first salary as a birthday gift to you. Yes, how can I forget the birthday of my creator, love of my life. I am sorry I couldn’t contact you lately. There’s a shitload of work piled upon me. I hope you understand and please enjoy the lavish dinner at your favorite restaurant and the bills are on me :) Tons of love, Aryan.  To all those parents whose children are abroad. love Kintu.

… people can’t circulate like civilized humans in a grocery store. The rules of the road should apply when it’s super busy and everyone has a cart. Directions in aisles should have sides. And if you need something across the aisle, park your cart to the side, and walk across to get what you need. Don’t just nosedive your cart into the counter traffic, like a savage. If you need to pass a slow bastard, you should look for incoming traffic before passing. Instead of inserting yourself in the middle like you can defy all properties of matter and just walk through people, wait for a logical opening. For crying out loud. Abruptly stopping is also completely ridiculous. Best see if there is anyone behind you before doing that, no? If you see a friend, park your carts and go to the side. Have your chit-chat there. You wouldn’t stop traffic for a chat on the road, so don’t do it in a store. And, my favorite: if they are giving out little freebies at Costco, and you abruptly stop, leave your cart sideways, to all hell with people— I want my free cracker—you are a son of a bitch and you deserve to die. Okay maybe not that bad, but that is a pretty up there in slow-witted-dummy-sees-shiny-thing terms. That’s like ditching your car in the middle of the intersection and running out because you just saw that McDonalds is having a free coffee day, and your brain got so excited it forgot basic logic. Park your damned cart and go get your little crackers like a decent human, you bastard. *shakes fist at skies*

I returned from office last evening. Untied my shoes. I could feel a pair of hands on my shoulders. My 11 year old sis was giving me a massage. What more does a man a need after a 9 hour job?? I sensed something fishy. The one who snatches away my cup of tea, is giving me a massage!! Why?? Me:”which chocolate do you need from me now??” She:”none. You were this tired. Felt pity for you. That’s it.” Me:”That was a lame reason.” She:”actuallly…”(sliding herself a bit closer and hugging me).. Me:”speak up kid. I don’t have the whole day.” She:”ILostYourNewPendriveThatIHadBorrowedForMyMusicClasses.ReallySorry.WillPayYouThroughSomewayOrTheOther.” Me:(Hulk smashing her thrice in my head) ”take a breathe girl. Chill, its okay. Get me 90 in Maths this time. It will be repaid.” i smiled and she left my room immediately. So this was why she felt pity of me. I hate it when she feels pity for me..

I hate it when someone’s faith isn’t rewarded. A devotee praying to his/her god for saving the life of his daughter, only to lose her in a car accident.A faithful and caring husband coming home to an empty home after his wife registered a false case against him and left him broken for someone else.An employee who gave 30 years of his life to an organization, only to be mistreated by the same after retirement.An aspiring writer whose first draft of the novel he wrote is stolen by his friend to be sold ahead to a publisher.The parents who gave everything they had for their children’s education and well-being, only to be ignored and left alone in their declining years.A sportsperson who played all his life for a single team with all his energy only to be left out and forced to live a gloomy life, without proper farewell and treatment.You invest and invest and invest, only to be left empty handed at the end. I think you can relate with every example that I wrote. A different face, a different person, a different story.

“I hate it when you don't put the dishes into the sink Anisha!” “Oh Mom, you know me right? After all, you won't rest till the time you don't do things yourself.” “Very funny. Now take this lunch box and I better don't see any food left when you come back.” “Yes Ma! And please take your medicines on time. I hope I don't find them lying here when I come back.” Her mother smiled and showed her the clock which indicated it was time she left for office. Anisha grabbed her lunchbox kissed her mother and left. Sitting quietly in the corner of the living room, Pooja looked at her friend Trisha in awe. “Did I just imagine that? Is that really your sister-in-law?” “She is my sister. We got her a little 25 years late. That's it.” Trisha replied and smiled.

A hate letter I hate how I forced myself to tell you to leave me alone. But mostly I hate how each and every time you failed to do what I said, forcing me to hurt once more by having to repeat it. I hate how you’re making your way in and out of my life like it’s your home. But mostly I hate that I wanted it to be your home. I hate how you made everything remind me of you like you’re the only person in this world. But mostly I hate that you were the only one in my world. I hate when you say there’s no one like me because there are plenty like me who you have not yet hurt. But mostly I hate that I needed to be like no one else for you. I hate when you say I am the one you love the most. There’s no reason for that one. I just hate to hear you using that word like you know what it means. I hate that you so stubbornly want to share everything with me like what I think matters. But mostly I hate that I can’t stop caring. I hate that I hate everything about you. But mostly I hate that I can’t hate you. P.S I love you

“I hate it when it rains when you are about to get on the roads.” thought Mr Mehta. He got down from the train and started walking along the railway platform with his bag on his side. “Every year!” He pulled out his umbrella and glared at the sky. Wristwatch showed the time - 8:22 AM. He glanced at the view outside. While strolling past a tea-stand a voice said - “Babuji (sir), tea?” “No, my son is waiting for me.” Mr. Mehta said as his pace quickened. He came outside the station. His son was nowhere to be seen. Silently he sat on the bench and took out his tiffin from his disheveled bag. He looked at the wristwatch again - 8:25 AM exact. He looked up at the sky and smiled. “Ramesh loved rains so much. He never knew rains would play with our lives.” Mr. Mehta sighed. He solemnly ate the meal in complete silence. After he was done, he kept his tiffinbox back into the bag and waited for his son. As he would every year wait, on this very day since his son died in a rain hit road accident 6 years ago while coming to pick him up at the Railway Station.

Please Aditi, please eat this cake and prove her wrong.” “Aashu, please stop this now. Aditi died 2 years back. Please understand Aashu. Stop this please.” But he could move. She left him alone at the cremation ground. Next morning, she found a pale, cold body with a smile on his face. When Aashu’s body reached hospital, doctors declared brought dead. But somewhere beyond, in the heaven, maybe the broken hearts had united. ….

“Why are you doing like this?” She said. “What did I do ?” I asked avoiding the eye contact. “Are you sad ? Would you like to tell me why ? “ She asked with concern tempting me to talk. “Nothing like that” I tried to reply cheerfully , hiding my hurt from the previous fight. and sighed. “Will you tell me , if there is any problem ?” She asked in unconvinced voice. I smiled at her and replied " Of course I will let you know" My mind whispered “I hate it when you melt again, seeing her care and forgive her, blinded by love, knowing you will get hurt again.” I replied to my mind softly " Sometimes words are not needed, Actions speak a lot. She is sorry about that incident. She wants me to be happy". I hugged her , reassuring things are normal. She is too proud to say sorry aloud and I am too proud to agree I am hurt. Our life will move on like this.

“ I hated it when I saw those tears in her eyes.” She was sitting at a corner of the bench. She was my friend and hostel mate. Today , in the morning I had seen her going hurriedly to meet her boyfriend. She was ecstatic and beaming with joy. I had known her since the day I put my foot on the hostel dormitory. Our first day as new juniors was quite happening. Terror of seniors made us close irrespective of our differences. She had told me about her new phone friend. She was good in studies too and even scolded me for my lack of interest in the course books. She gradually became engrossed in her new found love with whom she started her dream life in virtuality. I used to try to talk to her but she had no time for us. She was totally all by herself and her phone. That day she told me she is going to meet her online virtual love and they had planned their entire day. I was happy for her yet I was scared if her expectations were high. I didn't discourage her seeing her child like excitement. I wished her luck and told her to give me full on report of how it went. I had the plan of visiting the Gurudwara in the evening. I loved the lake side on the other side of Gurudwara. One can see people walking , sitting in groups and children just roaming here and there. I loved the serenity it provided . I loved there sitting alone and thinking. I as usual went there scanning a perfect spot to contemplate my boring life, I saw my friend sitting alone crying silently. I went to her, I sat beside her. She suddenly realized this presence and composed her. I asked her “ Deepu what are you doing here?” She replied with a sad smile “ nothing yaar,I am missing him”. I knew then and there , she was lying. Later I got to know from her roommate , she was dumped by his so called boyfriend for not being allowing him to get physical with her. I hate it when the immature boys tend to misuse the name of love to fulfill their lust. I hate it when they don't even think of the consequences it will have on the other person's life. I hate it when this totally makes the definition of love skewed. I hate it when due to this type of incidents , the person who was full of love feels nothing.

I hate it when someone makes a casual remark on how someone else’s success has been an easy ride. So, I have this cousin who is very haughty. Once some of my cousins were sitting and talking about one of our distant cousin who lost eyesight in his left eye due to an injury sustained in an accident. Despite his disability, he aced one of the most difficult entrance examination (CAT-Common Admission Test) which is required for the admissions to elite business colleges in India (IIM’s). We were praising him as how he never got demoralized and toiled to achieve his goal. To which our haughty cousin said “ Abay, itna zaheen toh nahin hai woh, usey handicapped quota se admission mila hoga, tumhein kya pata!”. Translation: “He wasn’t smart for most of his life, he might have got the admission via handicapped quota”. Instead of feeling completely shocked at his comment like my other cousins, I felt pity for my haughty cousin since at the age of 32, he hadn't developed the wisdom to make a good judgement. Glossary Handicapped quota: Reservation of a percentage of total seats for differently-abled and disabled candidates in educational institutes in India.

Me- I really don't know bhojpuri. X- But how's that possible? Me- Bihar doesn't mean bhojpuri. X- But most people don't know the difference between Bihari and bhojpuri. Me- You must not be knowing the difference but I very well know it. X- Did I offend you? Me- Is that even a question to ask, of course you did. X- Oh sorry! I didn't mean to , it was just to make you smile. I’m still contemplating as to why on earth he thought it will make me smile. There was another person I was talking to, let's call him Z. He's a NRI. Z- So you didn't tell me where you are from ? Me- I’m from Bihar. Z- Really? Me- umm.. yes but why do you ask that? Z- ah…nm. So which language you wanna talk in . Do you know Punjabi? Or we can talk in hindi? Me- Nope, I don't know punjabi ,we can talk in hindi. Btw, I’m even comfortable with English. Z-okay! Aapki English aachi hai (Your English is good). Me- Ty I thought it to be a normal complement but there was more to come. Z- Aapki education kaha matlab Bihar me hi .. waha pe logo ko English aati hai?(where did you get your education from, in bihar? … Do people know english there?) Finally I understood what he meant by that ‘Really?’. Me-Now I get it, you meant my English is way too good for being in Bihar. Fyi, People out here know English and that to really well. Yes! I hate it when i’m judged for being a Bihari.

“I hate it when you call him , Mom.” Natasha shouted at her Mom. Her father had left her and her mom when she was very little. She stood first in every examination. Won every scholarship she could to relieve the monetary burden on her family. Today morning,Natasha recieved the news that she had cleared her UPSC civil exams with flying colours. She was hopeful of becoming an IAS now. She looked sternly at her mother, “Why did you have to call him, Maa?” Her mother took a deep breath and responded, “Years back your father had mocked us and asked what could have I done.” “I had called him to let him know that I raised my daughter to be an IAS.”

I hate it when people call “Hindi film industry” as Bollywood! I feel its such a frivolous term. Throughout the world, bollywood is reduced to song and dance and bollywood zumba classes. Though its silly to say now, since this word has been listed in oxford dictionary long back but it still lacks intensity. According to Merriam-Webster's etymology, the word -- which means "Bombay (Mumbai), traditional centre of the Indian film industry + Hollywood" -- first found a mention in 1976. Many veteran actors are not to happy with this pop term. Naseeruddin Shah, who hates being referred to as a "Bollywood actor", said at the function: "The term Bollywood was used to mock us by the western press. And it's just an indication of our own idiocy that we still use it." The late actor Om Puri in an interview with DNA had said, “Bollywood - whenever western people refer to it -- they mean Hindi films. They say 'Oh those song and dance films.' So it is a derogatory term. These terms are created by the media." We ourselves somewhere physchologically get surprised that bollywood can make good movies too. I feel its this term that takes away credit and seriousness of Indian films. Also, actors like Mr Bachchan, Aishwarya Rai, Ranbir Kapoor, Priyanka Chopra have expressed their disapproval to this coinage.
